Job Description:
Aan de slag als surveillant in Amstelveen?
Bent u multi-inzetbaar, zorgvuldig én deskundig? Bij 65plus In het Onderwijs zijn wij geregeld op zoek naar AOW-medewerkers die willen werken als toezichthouder bij een middelbare school, mbo, hbo of universiteit. Zo zoeken wij momenteel voor een opdrachtgever in Amstelveen een ervaren en gemotiveerde toezichthouder. Bekijk de volledige vacature en solliciteer.

Wie zoekt 65plus In het Onderwijs?
Als toezichthouder bij een voorgezet onderwijs in Amstelveen gaat u aan de de slag als toezichthouder in de examenklassen. U bent medeverantwoordelijk voor een goed en eerlijk verloop van het tentamen, examen of ander toetsingsmoment. U bent hierbij breed inzetbaar, want uw werkzaamheden bestaan onder andere uit het uitdelen en innemen van examen- of tentamenpapieren en het doen van identiteitscontroles en controles van hulpmiddelen. Naast multi-inzetbaar bent u ook zorgvuldig en deskundig; u zorgt voor een betrouwbare, valide én transparante toetsing en handhaaft hierbij de criteria van de examencommissie. Als toezichthouder is het belangrijk dat u ervoor zorgt dat de leerlingen zich aan de COVID- maatregelen houden. U durft de leerlingen aan te spreken op een vriendelijke manier. Wij zoeken toezichthouders die voor de aankomende periode beschikbaar zijn:
We zijn op zoek naar 4 toezichthouders
Startdatum is 1 februari tot aan de voorjaarsvakantie
De werktijden van 08:00 tot 14:00 uur


U bent woonachtig in Amstelveen
U heeft ervaring als surveillant of toezichthouder bij scholen
U durft de leerlingen aan te spreken, uiteraard wel op een normale vriendelijke manier! Het is belangrijk dat u zichtbaar bent, zodat de leerlingen weten dat u de to Mensen moeten zichtbaar zijn, zodat de leerlingen zich houden aan de COVID maatregelen.
U bent in bezit van een VOG
Over 65plus In het Onderwijs
Maak kennis met 65plus In het Onderwijs, dé arbeidsbemiddelaar in de onderwijssector. Al sinds 1975 plaatsen wij onderwijsmedewerkers bij uiteenlopende onderwijsinstellingen in Nederland, zoals basisscholen, middelbare scholen en het beroepsonderwijs. Ook plaatsen wij onderwijsmedewerkers in het volwassenenonderwijs en het speciaal onderwijs (remedial teachers). In ons bestand hebben wij examinatoren, surveillanten, beoordelaars, docenten, huiswerkbegeleiders, conciërges, receptionisten, klusjesmannen en schoonmakers. Afhankelijk van de functie beschikken de medewerkers over lesbevoegdheden.

Stuur uw sollicitatie
Bent u enthousiast geraakt over deze vacature en voldoet u aan de gestelde functie-eisen? Solliciteren is heel eenvoudig: u klikt op onderstaande ‘groene button’ en volgt de verdere instructies. Uiteraard kunt u ook contact opnemen met ons regiokantoor in Noord- Holland. Bel naar 020 - 675 85 81 of stuur een e-mail naar amsterdam@65plus.nl. Geef bij uw sollicitatie duidelijk aan in welk vakgebied u ervaring heeft, welke werkzaamheden u eerder heeft uitgevoerd en wat uw beschikbaarheid is.

Aan de slag als toezichthouder in Amstelveen?
Bent u multi-inzetbaar, zorgvuldig én deskundig? Bij 65plus In het Onderwijs zijn wij geregeld op zoek naar AOW-medewerkers die willen werken als toezichthouder bij een middelbare school, mbo, hbo of universiteit. Op dit moment zijn wij op zoek naar ervaren toezichthouders die woonachtig zijn in de omgeving Amstelveen. Bekijk de volledige vacature en solliciteer.
Wat gaat u doen?
De leerlingen krijgen digitaal les en de docent kan niet alles in de gaten houden in de klas. Daarom zijn wij op zoek naar een toezichthouder die in staat is het gedrag van groepen leerlingen zodanig te sturen dat een prettige leer- en werkomgeving wordt gewaarborgd. De werkzaamheden bestaan onder meer uit:
Toezicht houden in de klas.
Het aanspreken van leerlingen in geval van ongewenst of ontoelaatbaar gedrag.
Assistentie bij voorkomende onderwijsondersteunende werkzaamheden van uiteenlopende aard.
Wij zoeken iemand die het onderwijs een warm hart toedraagt en bereid is waar en wanneer nodig de handen uit de mouwen te steken. Verder kan de toezichthouder leerlingen corrigeren met behoud van relatie, is vriendelijk en duidelijk, geeft en verlangt respect en stelt zich te allen tijde correct op. Daarnaast is het tevens belangrijk dat u aan onderstaande eisen voldoet:
U bent woonachtig in Amstelveen of directe omgeving.
U heeft ervaring in een soortelijke functie.
U bent flexibel inzetbaar in werktijden
Over 65plus In het Onderwijs

Solliciteer nú
Voldoet u aan het functieprofiel en wilt u graag aan de slag als toezichthouder? Aarzel niet en solliciteer vandaag nog via de ‘solliciteer button’ en volg de verdere instructies. Wanneer uw profiel en arbeidswensen aansluiten op de vacature en eisen van onze opdrachtgever, nemen wij telefonisch of per e-mail contact met u op. Heeft u nog vragen over werken via 65plus? Bekijk dan zeker onze veelgestelde vragen (FAQ).

Aan de slag als Digital Assistent Floormanager in Amstelveen?
Bent u multi-inzetbaar, zorgvuldig en digitaal vaardig? Bij 65plus In het Onderwijs zijn wij op zoek naar AOW-gerechtigde kandidaten die willen werken als Assistent Floormanager bij een middelbare school, MBO, HBO of universiteit. Bekijk de volledige vacature en solliciteer.

Wat gaat u doen?
De Assistent Floormanager Digitaal Toetsen heeft een essentiële rol en vormt de spil tussen faculteiten, ondersteunende diensten en externe partijen tijdens de afname van digitale toetsen. Hierbij werkt u nauw samen met docenten, ICT-ondersteuners en surveillanten en heeft u een coördinerende rol tijdens het afnemen van een examen. Samen met de faculteiten en de Floormanager waarborgt u de kwaliteit en betrouwbaarheid van het proces rondom de afname van de toetsen. U ziet toe op het naleven van de geldende regels, afspraken en procedures.

Wat verwachten wij van u als Assistent Floormanager?
Als Assistent Floormanager kunt u via ons worden ingezet bij het voortgezet onderwijs, mbo, hbo en/of universiteit. Het is een pre als u ervaring heeft in het hoger onderwijs met relevante kennis en ervaring met de inzet en werking van digitale toetsapplicaties en classroom management software.
Verder heeft u ervaring met het gebruik van ICT-middelen in brede zin en goede kennis van de MS-Office software in het bijzonder. De werktijden variëren van 08:00 tot 22:00 en vereisen een flexibele inzet voornamelijk tijdens de piekweken.
U bent communicatief sterkUitleg geven aan grote groepen is voor u geen probleemU heeft een sterk verantwoordelijkheidsgevoelU bent in staat om prioriteiten te stellen door hoofd- en bijzaken te onderscheidenU beschikt over aantoonbare computervaardighedenU beschikt over een sterk ontwikkeld gevoel voor dienstverleningU werkt uitstekend in teamverbandU beschikt over uitstekende communicatieve vaardigheden in het Nederlands en Engels en kan dit toepassen via de mail, telefoon en helpdesk software.

Solliciteer nú
Voldoet u aan het functieprofiel en wilt u graag aan de slag als assistent floormanager? Solliciteer direct via de ‘solliciteer button’ of door contact op te nemen met ons regiokantoor Noord-Holland in Zaandam. Bel naar 020 610 56 02 of stuur een e-mail naar planningamsterdam@65plus.nl. Geef bij uw sollicitatie duidelijk aan in welk vakgebied u ervaring heeft, welke werkzaamheden u eerder heeft uitgevoerd en wat uw beschikbaarheid is.

Wilt u graag aan de slag, maar zoekt u net een andere functie? Wij hebben diverse (soortgelijke) vacatures! Bekijk de vacatures van onze specialisaties In het Onderwijs, Op de Weg en In Goede Handen of schrijf u vrijblijvend in.

Remedial Teacher / Ondersteuning van Intern Begeleider Brede School De Springplank
Omvang: 0,4 fte (16 uur per week)
Plaatsingsdatum: 25 januari 2021
Met ingang van: zo spoedig mogelijk
Dienstverband: in eerste instantie tijdelijk, maar het dienstverband zal bij goed functioneren omgezet worden naar onbepaalde tijd op deze school of op een andere school binnen Stichting KBA Nw West.
Salarisschaal: Schaal L10 of L11, afhankelijk van ervaring, op basis van de CAO PO. Daarbij is Amsterdam een van de vijf grote steden die in de komende vier jaar een Grote Steden toeslag zal ontvangen van het kabinet. Voor bevoegde leerkrachten van de Springplank betekent dit dat zij een brutotoeslag op jaarbasis zullen ontvangen.

Wie zijn wij?
De Springplank is een brede en complete buurtschool in de Van Galenbuurt vlakbij het Erasmuspark in Amsterdam met ca. 190 leerlingen. De kinderen kunnen naast het basisonderwijs terecht in de voorschool, kinderopvang en buitenschoolse opvang en zo biedt onze school alles voor kinderen tot 13 jaar met diverse achtergronden om te spelen, leren en groeien in een gezonde en lichte omgeving. Er is op onze school aandacht voor gezondheid, sport en cultuur en is er een goede samenwerking met de ouders. Daarnaast blinkt onze school uit in alle leuke sportactiviteiten die georganiseerd worden in de twee gymzalen en op de enorme buitenspeelplaats die bij het vernieuwde gebouw met veel natuurlijk licht horen.

De Springplank is onderdeel van Stichting KBA Nw West. Stichting KBA Nw West telt zo’n 200-220 medewerkers. In totaal bestaat de stichting uit een ondersteunend bestuurskantoor en zeven basisscholen, verspreid over verschillende wijken van Amsterdam. Vertrouwen, verantwoordelijkheid en betrokkenheid zijn de kernwaarden van de stichting.
De visie van de stichting luidt: “Wij zijn een Amsterdamse leer- en leefgemeenschap waarin de ontwikkeling van onze Amsterdamse kinderen centraal staat. Een gemeenschap waarin iedereen zich gehoord en gezien voelt: de kinderen, de ouders én de medewerkers. Iedere school heeft ruimte om zich vanuit eigenheid, zingeving en creativiteit te verbinden met de buurt en zo invulling te geven aan uitstekend onderwijs.”
Klik hier voor een filmpje van onze stichting.

Wat zoeken wij in onze nieuwe collega?
In verband met het vertrek van onze huidige RT’er en de behoefte aan extra ondersteuning van de IB’er zijn wij op zoek naar versterking van ons team. We zijn op zoek naar iemand die één dag per week als remedial teacher zal gaan werken en één dag als ondersteuner van de huidige intern begeleider. Voor ons zijn de volgende punten essentieel:
Jij hebt ervaring als remedial teacher en kunt kinderen begeleiden die een taal- of rekenachterstand hebben
Jij hebt ervaring als intern begeleider, bij voorkeur in Amsterdam. Samen met de andere ib’er ben je verantwoordelijk voor de leerlingenzorg vanuit het kwaliteitsbeleid van de school
Je bent in het bezit van een PABO diploma
Je bent een belangrijke schakel in een organisatie in ontwikkeling
Je wilt graag samen leren in een prettig team
Je houdt zicht op de cyclus van opbrengst- en handelingsgericht werken
Eén van je werkdagen valt in ieder geval op dinsdag, woensdag of donderdag

Reageren
Je kunt je sollicitatiebrief met c.v. richten aan directie@kbsdespringplank.nl, t.a.v. R. van Hilst. Ook voor nadere informatie kun je je wenden tot Ronald van Hilst, de directeur van de school, via telefoonnummer 06-48498031 of bovenstaand emailadres.
De sluitingsdatum van de vacature is 1 maart 2021, maar we hopen zo snel mogelijk een nieuwe collega aan te nemen en zien je reactie dan ook graag zo snel mogelijk tegemoet.

Arbeidsvoorwaarden:

Job Title: Mandarin / Chinese teacher & optional Chinese cooking teacher
Job Description: We are looking for a Chinese teacher to teach Chinese to our company director Jeroen. He already passed HSK 1, 2, 3 and 4. But he needs to refresh it and then his goal is to eventually obtain HSK 5. Writing with a pen is not important, but to learn to select the right characters via pinyin is relevant. Of course his vocal skills and listening ability are top priority. Jeroen wants to improve his Chinese, so he can better talk directly with Chinese factory bosses while visiting China. This will help him more easily build a meaningful partnership with them to improve mutual understanding and eventually to help grow his business.In order to cultivate a Chinese learning environment the more Chinese talk the better. So from this perspective Jeroen is also interested in getting Chinese cooking classes in Chinese.You don't need to have a teaching or cooking education for this job. But you need to be fluent in Chinese and to be good at cooking is of course a plus. The job might be perfect for a student. It is just for once a week.Location: Amsterdam city center我们期待您的申请!Soort dienstverband: Tijdelijk, Bepaalde tijdSalaris: €12,00 - €18,00 per uurArbeidsvoorwaarden:ReiskostenvergoedingWerkschema:AvondwerkWeekendThuiswerken:Nee

Job Title: Classroom teacher for new International Crossover Class
Job Description: Classroom teacher for new International Crossover Class(grade 5/6 level – full time - start April 2021)Does developing a new initiative and guiding young learners towards internationally minded secondary education intrigue you? We’re looking for an innovative educator who has experience with the international primary or middle years programme with strong collaboration skills, as you will be working closely with the Hermann Wesselink College (HWC) in Amstelveen setting up the International Crossover Class for children aged 11 and 12 which will start in March 2021.What is the International Crossover Class?The ICC offers high quality education for international students who want to start or continue studying an international curriculum. Children aged 11 or 12 who are new to the Netherlands and have not yet decided whether they want to enter Dutch, bilingual or international education, are welcome to join. In the Netherlands the first year of high school is for 12-year-olds. Children in this age group are not allowed to attend a Dutch primary school (group 8) or secondary school (grade 6) because they don’t speak the Dutch language or because they are too young. Therefore, new students who want to enter Dutch secondary education have to attend an intermediate year (language class) first to learn the Dutch language. If they prefer international education, the ICC could be a suitable place to start.The ICC offers an innovative curriculum. We will be following the International Middle Years Curriculum (IMYC). The language of instruction is English. A minimum of two Dutch lessons is also offered to our students as part of their integration in the Dutch culture. Our initiative supports all students who are in a transitional year between primary and secondary education. The Hermann Wesselink College currently offers secondary education in two main streams: Dutch and bilingual. They are enthusiastic to launch the ICC working in close collaboration with Amstelland International Primary School. The HWC already welcomes a large number of international students.If you are: · a creative and innovative teacher with the understanding of and experience with inquiry-based learning;· highly skilled in implementing positive behaviour strategies, embracing global citizenship, diversity and understanding the needs of international children;· passionate about developing a growth mindset and inspiring children to become curious about their learning processes;· by nature an educator who believes in differentiation and understands multiple learning styles creating a strong framework in which your students can thrive;· as curious about the Dutch culture and host country as your students will be;· compassionate, kind, helpful, flexible, open to new ideas and a good sense of humour;· by nature a leader, an innovator and a team player.Required: · Qualified Teacher Status: DUO accreditation permitting you to teach this particular age group. Dual competence, both primary and secondary school teaching qualification is a plus;· fluent in spoken and written English;· preferably specialist experience in the IMYC or IB MYP;· 3 to 5 years international (primary and/or 1st or 2nd year secondary) school teaching experience;· a European work visa;· excellent knowledge and experience of different teaching and educational methodologies;· excellent interpersonal, organisational and class management skills;· the ability to seek contact and take the initiative to work closely with the Hermann Wesselink College and your future colleagues;· the willingness to collaborate with Amstelland International School and team;· in the process of learning the Dutch language or proficient in Dutch;· provide a police clearance (Verklaring Omtrent Gedrag).Salary scale according to Dutch primary school labour law (CAO) L10 (min. € 2678 max. € 4113 full-time).All non-Dutch teaching qualifications must be verified by DUO. We are not able to employ a teacher until this process has been completed. Details of how qualifications can be verified are to be found on the DUO website via the link.Has this vacancy sparked your enthusiasm? Please send your application to the attention of Mrs. Wendy van Vliet with a letter of motivation along with your CV and contact details of two professional references. For a quick view of the Hermann Wesselink College and Amstelland International School, you can visit the websites. Please click here and here. Your references will only be contacted if you are in the final selection. All applications are required to be written in English and submitted before 1 February 2021.Deadline sollicitaties: 1-2-2021Verwachte startdatum: 1-4-2021Job Types: Full-time, ContractSalary: From €2,678.00 per monthExperience:international education: 4 years (Required)Work Remotely:No

As an EF Course Leader you will travel abroad with a group of students during the school holidays. The trips last from two to four weeks depending on the course and the destination. You will have to be available for the students whenever they need you. Together you will do lots of different activities, dance at discos, play football or just hang out at the beach.
You will work in an international environment where you will meet and work with people from all over the world. The students are between 10-18 years old and they study English, Spanish, German or French (ADAPT AGES & LANGUAGES TO YOUR MARKET). Even though there are lots of fun activities and excursions already planned for the students, YOU will make a great impact on the students’ experience by being a great leader!
Hiring Manager – Sales Office
Line Manager – Destination Office
Your key tasks will consist of, but not be limited to:
Travelling together with a group of students to/from the destination
Work as part of an international team – during the trip you will report to the local manager and together with colleagues from the local team and other Course Leaders you will look after an international group of students. All students in the destination are all our responsibility.
Assisting with student arrivals and departures.
On-going promotion of activities and encouragement of student participation.
Conducting daily meetings with students after lessons to communicate information regarding activity choices, meeting times and places and upcoming events.
Attending and running all activities for your group. Do research about different activities and plan your stay and the activity chart together with local staff.
Collecting money for bus passes and optional excursions.
Monitoring daily attendance and keeping up to date records and paperwork.
Attending all leader meetings.
Participating in the duty rotas when required.
Ensuring students follow the safety rules set as well that the EF behaviour code is followed by students at all times and inform management immediately if there are any issues or problems.
Be available for the students 24/7. There may be situations where you have to make quick decisions as a leader.
Work late hours, for example at the discos.
Dealing with problems, welfare and emergency situations should they arise.
Requirements
Enthusiastic, organised and a natural leader.
Experience of working with young people (example given: teacher, scout leader).
Excellent interpersonal skills.
Capable of using your own initiative.
Responsible and flexible.
Fluent in (INSERT THE MARKET LANGUAGE) and the language spoken in the course’s destination country (e.g English, Spanish, German, French).
Attend training prior to your contract commencing.


About EF Education First
At EF we believe that the world is better when people try to understand one another. Since 1965, we have helped millions of people see new places, experience new cultures, and learn new things about the world and about themselves. Our culturally immersive education programs—focused on language, travel, cultural exchange, and academics—turn dreams into international opportunities.
When you join EF, you join a multicultural and diverse community working across more than 600 schools and offices in 50 countries, all with one shared mission of opening the world through education. Whoever you are, whatever you are passionate about—we welcome you and want you to bring that to work every day. EF is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and we are committed to inclusion and belonging across race, ethnicity, gender, age, religion, parental status, identity, experience and everything else that makes you unique.
Founded in Sweden in 1965, EF has school and offices around the world, including hubs in Boston, London, Mexico City, São Paulo, Shanghai, Stockholm, Zürich, and more. Learn more at https://ef.com.

Fairphone is a social enterprise driving change in the electronics industry from the inside out. Our business model is based on social values and securing continuity and centers around producing and marketing smartphones in a way that puts social and environmental values first.

We are looking for a hands-on German speaking Customer Support Agent to become part of our growing team of passionate people who work to achieve our mission. If you are as excited as we are about creating positive change, then have a look at our vacancy below.

LOCATION: Amsterdam · HOURS: 40 hours/week · START: ASAP · DEADLINE TO APPLY: 31.01.2021
About your Role

The Fairphone Community is the main focus of our support team.
As our 1st line Customer Support Agent, you will be a Fairphone ambassador, providing our customers with the best service: you will meet our (potential) customers’ needs over the phone and via email, using your technical expertise, creativity, passion and active listening. You will listen, offer advice, turn around experiences when needed and provide relevant feedback to others within our company, influencing changes in different teams and processes!

Your Profile
You are excited about helping people! You are a problem-solver at heart and understand how important technology is nowadays in everyday life.

You show ownership as well as the ability to effectively prioritize and manage your time and tasks.
You are a quick learner and have the required skills to escalate technical challenges with other relevant departments within Fairphone.
You are a great teammate who likes to collaborate and have a positive attitude.
You are adaptable with changes - Fairphone is a dynamic, fast paced, multicultural environment.
You feel a strong connection with Fairphone’s mission and values.
You live or are willing to live in the Netherlands and have the nationality of an EU/EEA country or Switzerland.
Your Responsibilities
You will be the friendly voice of Fairphone, providing effective troubleshooting and personal support, addressing both hardware and software related issues, over different support channels: Zendesk, Sprout, telephone and occasionally in person.

You solve our community requests through the whole customer journey.
You escalate complex issues to 2nd line support.
You proactively identify ways to avoid recurrence of customer issues by regularly reviewing the processes and recommending changes.
You will be multitasking through multiple systems while troubleshooting with customers.
You will have to meet average handle time, NPS scores as well as schedule adherence to make sure we support our community in the most efficient way!
Your Skills & Experiences
You have at least 2 years of experience in customer facing roles, of which 12-18 months in Customer Support.

You have excellent customer service skills: you are empathetic, accurate, compassionate, responsive, resourceful, proactive.
You love troubleshooting technology! Experience with ticket systems like Zendesk, order management systems, and chat support is a plus.
You have strong written and verbal communication skills and are able to adapt your communication style to different customers.
You have the ability to use critical thinking and logic skills to isolate and resolve technical issues in a timely manner.

About Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam
The ambition of Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam is clear: to contribute to a better world through outstanding education and ground-breaking research. We strive to be a university where personal development and commitment to society play a leading role. A university where people from different disciplines and backgrounds collaborate to achieve innovations and to generate new knowledge. Our teaching and research encompass the entire spectrum of academic endeavour – from the humanities, the social sciences and the natural sciences through to the life sciences and the medical sciences.


Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam is home to more than 26,000 students. We employ over 4,600 individuals. The VU campus is easily accessible and located in the heart of Amsterdam’s Zuidas district, a truly inspiring environment for teaching and research.


Diversity

We are an inclusive university community. Diversity is one of our most important values. We believe that engaging in international activities and welcoming students and staff from a wide variety of backgrounds enhances the quality of our education and research. We are always looking for people who can enrich our world with their own unique perspectives and experiences.


Faculty of Social Sciences

The Faculty of Social Sciences examines the major social problems of our time from multiple perspectives. From bullying at school to dealing with transnational immigration, from the rise of populist politicians to creating a self-reliant society. Only at the Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam you will find all the academic disciplines needed to understand these 'wicked problems': alongside the traditional disciplines such as sociology, anthropology and politics, we also research and teach the new social sciences such as communication science and management & organization science. We do not settle for easy answers in our teaching and research. Our researchers and students are critical thinkers and doers who work together to devise surprising solutions to the problems of today.


Working at the Faculty of Social Sciences means working with colleagues from a range of academic disciplines in an inspiring and personal work and study environment with excellent research facilities. We employ more than 250 staff members, and we are home to around 2,500 students.


About Active8 Planet

Active8 Planet is a three-year education innovation project in which Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam collaborates with eight European project partners to jointly develop, implement and assess the impact of a new Active8-Planet learning model. This learning model is based on 4 principles of planet-centred development:
interdisciplinary & intergenerational co-creation
people-centred design
university-business collaboration
environmental ambition and action
The core of Active8 Planet is its Learning Cycles. These will be implemented in each of the collaborating countries (The Netherlands, Belgium, Sweden and Slovenia). Within these Learning Cycles, multidisciplinary teams of students, teachers, and company professionals will co-create practice-based interventions in the areas of Sustainable Mobility, Circularity in the built environment, and Health & Wellbeing .

In the Dutch context students and teachers from Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam´s departments of Social and Cultural Anthropology and Organization Sciences will collaborate with engineers and designers from Huygen Engineers & Consultants in two consecutive academic years starting in September 2021-2022.

Company Description
Join the thousands of innovators, advocates and forces who are making an impact every day at one of the biggest footwear brands in the world. Whether you love to connect with consumers on the retail floor or want to drive our award-winning powerhouse in new directions, the SKECHERS team is the place to be. Learn more about our brand at www.skechers.nl.

Job Description
Our Supervisors make an incredible impact everyday on our customers, our teams and our company. They guide, teach, merchandise, process shipment, inspire, manage product, replenish, problem solve and more in short, they truly are the heartbeat of Skechers Retail!
SALES CHAMPION
Helps Management in leading the team when meeting and exceeding sales plan. Drives high unit velocity through an impeccably presented sales floor and outstanding customer service. Mentors the team in multiple retail skill-sets to elevate the store's performance and hits sales out of the park!
PRODUCT EXPERT
Lives, breathes and loves our footwear and ensures the store is a showpiece for our customers.
Impeccable merchandising, on-point signage & pricing and beautiful visual presentation are led and supported by this critical leader. Lastly, serves as a true brand ambassador for Skechers, showing off our product and educating our customers about our incredible shoes, accessories and apparel.
PEOPLE COACH
Team Player, Teacher and COACH! Supports the Management Team in supervising outstanding people processes, team development and ensures an amazing employee experience.
OPERATIONS GURU
Acts like an owner, assisting the Management Team in leading strong operational processes and routines that minimize shrink and drive profitability. Understands and insists on a clean, pretty store and a team that follows best practices for a healthy, profitable store.

Qualifications
First, leading a team to “win big” is what you love to do!
You are a sales-driver and you know how to help ensure your store crushes sales plan!
Your team is critical to your business and your customers, so your talent assessment and development skills are solid and you’re always working hard to get even better.
You’re an expert at the stock function and always know how to manage shipment and replenishment, no matter the season.
You still function effectively and even thrive in times of change and shifting priorities and have a strong ability to stay flexible to the unforeseen.
Communication could be your “middle name”, with your highly developed ability to convey information and set direction with your team in writing or verbally.
Colleagues might also call you a task‐master, as you utilize time and resources extremely well to meet deadlines, stay efficient and manage operational priorities.
Your retail/restaurant leadership experience makes you immediately credible in our business and a major source of support to your Management Team.
Finally, you have so much fun doing and being all of the above and share that excitement with those around you every day!

WHAT IS THE SECRET TO OUR SUCCESS? OUR PEOPLE!
We thrive on fashion, design without limits and aim to succeed while having fun in the process.
Here at Skechers, we don't only believe in internal development, but we encourage it! You can expect to grow with a company that believes in your talent and understands the importance of the investment for your future.
This is a unique chance to join a company with strong growth where you will receive a highly competitive remuneration (salary, commissions, discounts and other benefits) and professional career opportunities.

Company Description

Join the thousands of innovators, advocates and forces who are making an impact every day at one of the biggest footwear brands in the world. Whether you love to connect with consumers on the retail floor or want to drive our award-winning powerhouse in new directions, the SKECHERS team is the place to be. Learn more about our brand at about.skechers.com.

Job Description

Our Supervisors make an incredible impact everyday on our customers, our teams and our company. They guide, teach, merchandise, process shipment, inspire, manage product, replenish, problem solve and more in short, they truly are the heartbeat of Skechers Retail!

SALES CHAMPION
Helps Management in leading the team when meeting and exceeding sales plan. Drives high unit velocity through an impeccably presented sales floor and outstanding customer service. Mentors the team in multiple retail skill-sets to elevate the store's performance and hits sales out of the park!

PRODUCT EXPERT
Lives, breathes and loves our footwear and ensures the store is a showpiece for our customers.
Impeccable merchandising, on-point signage & pricing and beautiful visual presentation are led and supported by this critical leader. Lastly, serves as a true brand ambassador for Skechers, showing off our product and educating our customers about our incredible shoes, accessories and apparel.

PEOPLE COACH
Team Player, Teacher and COACH! Supports the Management Team in supervising outstanding people processes, team development and ensures an amazing employee experience.

OPERATIONS GURU
Acts like an owner, assisting the Management Team in leading strong operational processes and routines that minimize shrink and drive profitability. Understands and insists on a clean, pretty store and a team that follows best practices for a healthy, profitable store.

Qualifications
First, leading a team to “win big” is what you love to do!You are a sales-driver and you know how to help ensure your store crushes sales plan!Your team is critical to your business and your customers, so your talent assessment and development skills are solid and you’re always working hard to get even better.You’re an expert at the stock function and always know how to manage shipment and replenishment, no matter the season.You still function effectively and even thrive in times of change and shifting priorities and have a strong ability to stay flexible to the unforeseen.Communication could be your “middle name”, with your highly developed ability to convey information and set direction with your team in writing or verbally.Colleagues might also call you a task‐master, as you utilize time and resources extremely well to meet deadlines, stay efficient and manage operational priorities.Your retail/restaurant leadership experience makes you immediately credible in our business and a major source of support to your Management Team.Finally, you have so much fun doing and being all of the above and share that excitement with those around you every day!

WHAT IS THE SECRET TO OUR SUCCESS? OUR PEOPLE!

Here at Skechers, we don't only believe in internal development, but we encourage it! You can expect to grow with a company that believes in your talent and understands the importance of the investment for your future.
This is a unique chance to join a company with strong growth where you will receive a highly competitive remuneration (salary, commissions, discounts and other benefits) and professional career opportunities.

Wie zijn wij op bs. Elout?
De Elout is een energieke en gezellige in Amsterdam Oud-Zuid, die intensief vormgeeft aan passend onderwijs aan zo’n 165 leerlingen! Je komt te werken op een gezellige buurtschool in Amsterdam Oud-Zuid, waar het ”kind” centraal staat. Wij zijn een echte Amsterdamse school en vinden het belangrijk om elkaar goed te kennen en samen te werken met collega’s en ouders en leerlingen.
De Elout is een school met een gemengde leerling populatie. De leerlingen hebben verschillende culturele - en sociale achtergronden. Het onderwijs op De Elout wordt gekenmerkt door maatwerk, structuur en individuele aandacht. Met onze werkwijze bieden wij onderwijs op maat en geven wij álle kinderen een goede basis niet alleen voor hun vervolgstudie, maar ook voor hun totale verdere ontwikkeling. Dit realiseren we in een warm, betrokken en veilig pedagogisch klimaat. De leerkrachten halen het beste uit zichzelf om het beste uit de kinderen naar boven te halen. Ze hebben soms een leidende en dan weer coachende rol. We zijn kritisch, maken bewuste keuzes en zetten in op professionalisering. We maken gebruik van elkaars deskundigheid en halen externe kennis binnen om onszelf en ons onderwijs steeds een slag beter te maken.
‘Iedereen telt mee!’
Wij werken hard, maar willen ook plezier beleven op het werk. De kinderen doen bij ons kennis en vaardigheden op, die ervoor zorgen dat zij een prettige plek in onze samenleving verwerven en een actieve positieve bijdrage aan deze samenleving kunnen gaan leveren.
Naast de directeur en de groepsleerkrachten zijn er onderwijsassistenten werkzaam op onze school. Voor de optimale zorg en talentontwikkeling van de kinderen hebben wij een intern begeleider en diverse remedial teachers in dienst. Er zijn tevens een aantal vakleerkrachten verbonden aan de school voor beeldende vorming, muziek- en bewegingsonderwijs. Een management ondersteuner en een schoonmaker complementeren het gehele team.
Kijkt u ook eens op onze website www.bselout.nl of op onze facebook pagina.

Wie is Stichting KBA Nw West?
Stichting KBA Nw West telt zo’n 200-220 medewerkers. In totaal bestaat de stichting uit 1 ondersteunend bestuurskantoor en 7 basisscholen, verspreid over verschillende wijken van Amsterdam.
Vertrouwen, verantwoordelijkheid en betrokkenheid zijn de kernwaarden van de stichting.
De visie van de stichting luidt: Wij zijn een Amsterdamse leer- en leefgemeenschap waarin de ontwikkeling van onze Amsterdamse kinderen centraal staat. Een gemeenschap waarin iedereen zich gehoord en gezien voelt: de kinderen, de ouders én de medewerkers. Iedere school heeft ruimte om zich vanuit eigenheid, zingeving en creativiteit te verbinden met de buurt en zo invulling te geven aan uitstekend onderwijs.

Klik hier voor een filmpje van onze stichting.

Hoe kun je solliciteren?
Reageren kan via de directeur Hanife Sak door een e-mail te sturen naar: h.sak@bselout.nl of te bellen naar 020. 4702717.

Lecturer Marketing ManagementYou look back on a great career in business. Marketing is your passion. You have experienced the many ups and downs of entrepreneurship or management yourself in recent years, and you know the challenges of an international environment. We like to get in touch with professionals who teach our international higher professional education students the intricacies of Marketing.Inter College Business SchoolWe are a small-scale, private business school in the heart of Amsterdam. We train about 350 students to become entrepreneurs or enterprising managers. Our students follow a four-year hbo study programme and receive a Bachelor of Business Administration degree after passing. All teachers, graduation supervisors and members of the examination committee are entrepreneurs and know what it's like in practice. We believe in structure for our students and continuously encourage them to get the best out of themselves.For the class at Inter CollegeGiving lectures at Inter College is slightly different from giving lectures at any other university of applied sciences or university. We work in small teams, workshops and groups of up to 30 students. You will know each student not only by name, but also their character and strengths and weaknesses. Our students are stubborn, headstrong and not afraid to share their opinions. The interactive lectures are practice-oriented and evoke interesting discussions. Many students come from an entrepreneurial family and/or are already engaged in entrepreneurship. They are eager to convert what they have learned into practice.Who are you? As a lecturer for the Marketing modules, you are the role model and example for the student. As a professional, you know the difference between theory and practice and can share your experiences as a lesson for the future to our students. How are things really going in the business world? Only people who bring their knowledge from both backgrounds know. You know how to stimulate students with current practical examples in the field of modern Marketing.Function requirements § Relevant, completed university education (MBA)§ Experience in the field of (teaching) Marketing in an international context§ Teaching competence and experience§ Extensive practical experience in business§ Up to date with current developments within the field of expertise§ English proficiency at C1 level§ Passion and quality to share knowledge§ Social skills and strong presentation techniquesTerms and conditions of employmentIt is a part-time function at module level from 1 march 2021.Contact information‪For more information about the position, please contact Ms C. Description
Pearson is the world's leading learning company, with 24,000 employees in more than 75 countries working to help people of all ages make measurable progress in their lives through learning. Pearson provides learning materials, places of learning, technologies, assessments and services to teachers, professionals and students in order to help people everywhere aim higher and fulfil their true potential.
Our vision is to have a direct relationship with millions of lifelong learners and to link education to the way people aspire to live and work every day. To do that, we’ll collaborate with a wide group of partners to help shape the future of learning. We believe that we all need to embrace lifelong learning, continuously acquiring new knowledge and skills to thrive in an ever-changing and increasingly connected world.
The UK, Core and Growth Operations team is accountable for the end to end delivery of all operational activities whether directly managed, internally provided or externally partnered with. This extends to Supply Chain, Customer Service and Support, Facilities Management and Procurement,
Role overview
The CE Regional Director, Supply Chain will lead and be accountable for inventory planning and supply, distribution and manufacturing. This position provides overall direction and guidance to the operational activities of the organisation with the objective of maximising growth and profitability as well as day-to-day leadership and management to Supply Chain Operations. The role will also play a pivotal part in establishing a direct to consumer model across the Continental Europe landscape. This will take different forms across the geography, so an understanding of retail supply chains is key.
Key responsibilities
Manages operations by directing and coordinating activities consistent with established goals, objectives, and policies, through country or cluster leaderships

Manage a sustainable S&OP process, despite the variety of different approaches undertaken by Europe with a common aim.

Implement improved processes and management methods to optimise workflow aligned to global process, utilising the knowledge & expertise across the International Operations teams.

Contribute to and lead strategies and policies in supply chain, inventory and distribution management, streamlining, cost-reduction, production and materials planning, process improvement, team-building and supervision, and process optimisation aligned with organisational goals.

Develop and manage departmental budgets.

Maintain effective relationships suppliers and logistics including 3PL warehousing relationships ensuring adherence to agreed KPI.

Direct senior staff on contract negotiations and implementation of all third party logistics relationships and link with procurement colleagues to support direction & strategy.

Oversight of ocean freight, international air freight and all other domestic freight negotiations and rates, and will require links to EU Logistics function.

Customer and vendor chargeback management and corrective action initiatives are to be developed.

People Management to include the demonstrated ability to hire the best people and motivate and grow high performance teams. Mentor, coach and train the teams and build the required competencies for success. Able to voice opinions, debate and disagree, but will also respect current processes and final decisions.

Manage supervisors/managers/directors who lead demand and supply planning, manufacturing and distribution operations.

Is responsible for the overall direction, coordination, and evaluation of these individuals and team.

Carry out management responsibilities in accordance with the organisation. These include interviewing, hiring, and training employees; planning, assigning, and directing work; appraising performance; rewarding and disciplining employees; addressing complaints and resolving problems. Creates employee development plans and training needs for staff.

Must develop strong working relationships across the regions with the commercial leaders & develop a partnership based approach but not be afraid to challenge where areas do not benefit the wider Pearson objectives.

Qualifications
Essential skills and characteristics
Education
Educated to degree level (MBA from a recognised business school is a plus) with a minimum of 10-15 years of pertinent industry experience within a multinational company.

Ideally, experience should be broad-based within a bench-marked, highly recognised company within consumer products, retail, or publishing industry.

Experience in a multi-channel business environment and a minimum of five years in a management role with an accomplished track record of providing leadership to all aspects of the supply chain in a complex and rapidly changing environment.

Language Skills
Ability to read, analyze, and interpret common scientific and technical journals, financial reports, and legal documents.

Ability to respond to common inquiries or complaints from customers, regulatory agencies, or members of the business community.

Ability to effectively present information to senior management, public groups, and/or boards of directors.

Good command of English language

Mathematical Skills
Ability to work with general mathematical concepts and understanding of data, interpretation & solution drivers using analysis and facts as opposed to emotion.
Reasoning Ability
Ability to define problems, collect data, establish facts, and draw valid conclusions.
Ability to interpret an extensive variety of technical instructions in mathematical or diagram form and deal with several abstract and concrete variables.
Clear understanding of developing metrics and deriving solutions from these metrics, building confidence across stakeholder groups to ensure alignment to the business.

Desirable skills and characteristics
Ability to implement and lead change management and implementation projects, across geographies with the ability to drive change initiatives while maintaining a functioning, motivated and stable organisation with delivery results orientation.

Have extensive experience in retail supply chains with eCommerce & omni-channel solutions being a strength that will support the evolving direct to consumer strategy.

Ability to develop and implement succession planning, mentoring and future development programs for employees.

Ability to engage actively as a member of the senior leadership team and think beyond operations by embracing the vision and strategy of the organisation.

Wie zijn wij?
At EF Education First, we are travelers, innovators, thinkers and doers. We readily promote an open and collaborative workspace. Our people are our biggest asset, and together we have created a culture of cooperation, project ownership, and impact. As the world leader in international education, with more than 52,000 staff and teachers working in 52 countries around the globe, our mission is simple: Opening the world through education. We are looking for an enthusiastic Content Marketing Intern (5-6 months) ready to take on a creative challenge in our global online marketing team. You will focus on the creation of quality content for our brands in the UK and the Americas, therefore we are searching for a fluent English speaker. During this internship you will be working from our Amsterdam office.

Who are we?

Travix is part of Trip.com Group Limited (Nasdaq: TCOM), besides Trip.com, Ctrip, Skyscanner, and Qunar. The group is a leading one-stop travel service provider and one of the largest travel companies in the world.

Travix is one of the leading global online travel agencies with the brands CheapTickets, Vliegwinkel, BudgetAir, Flugladen and Vayama. Our mission is ‘the next journey at your fingertips’, which goes for both customers and employees. We provide extensive search and book capabilities for flights, hotels, rental cars and products such as insurances and parking. With 5 brands in over 40 countries and with over 55 different nationalities employed, a global mindset comes natural to us. Are you ready for a new journey at Travix?

As a Content Marketing Intern, you will:

Learn all the ins & outs in the field of content marketing, SEO, social media, newsletters (and a piece of Google Analytics & Facebook Analytics)
Research and write interesting content for our travel-loving community
Create newsletters
Create campaigns for airlines and tourism boards
Assist with content localization and SEO optimization
Analyze the performance of our Content Marketing efforts with tools such as Google Analytics, Google Admanager and Looker
Get a lot of responsibility and opportunities to own ideas
Support the Marketing team in various tasks across other marketing channels

This internship is for you if:

You are a fluent English speaker (Spanish language skills are a plus)
You have basic knowledge of Photoshop
You are enrolled throughout the entire duration of the internship in a relevant field of study (e.g. Marketing, Communication, Journalism)
You are available to work full-time for at least 5 months
You have a creative mindset exploding with ideas and a great willingness to meticulously learn the art of Content Marketing
You love writing and have excellent storytelling skills as well as a good eye for winning images and creatives
You love travelling and want to inspire others to travel too!
You are organized, self-disciplined, able to manage multiple competing priorities and deliver results under tight deadlines
You are eager to learn, hands-on and not afraid to try something new.

What you can expect:

A laptop to use during your internship
You will be thrown into the deep end and will get real responsibilities from day one!
A mentor who will guide you through your internship
Boost your Content Marketing knowledge through the roof; you will be able to tell your teachers at Uni how SEO strategies and content marketing work in practice
You will learn the tricks and traits of the flight industry from all the different angles, one of the most dynamic markets out there
We love to hear your ideas so there is a good deal of room to be creative and to build your legacy
Become part of a multinational team of specialists to inspire and support you!
Fun (online) team events
Internship allowance of €750 (gross) plus full travel costs between home and office covered


Are you ready to take on this challenge?

About Us

EF Education First is a global education company focusing on language, academic, cultural exchange, and educational travel programs.


We are 52,000 staff, faculty and teachers, working in over 612 offices and schools across 52 countries, and having a global presence in 116 countries. While we continue to grow, we strive to stay small so as to ensure agility, smart thinking and a fun place to work. For the past 53 years, EF has grown to include a range of programs that give students of all ages the freedom and confidence to explore the world through language, travel and education.


EF is committed to safeguarding and promoting the welfare of children and young adults and expects all staff and volunteers to share this commitment. References will be followed up and will ask specifically whether there is any reason that the applicant should not be engaged in situations where they have responsibility for, or substantial access to, persons under 18. Appropriate suitability checks and Garda Vetting will be conducted prior to confirmation of appointment.

Each participant’s personal background is a base for further development and better understanding of oneself as a coach and/or manager. The principle of coaching is that you then apply this insight knowledge in counseling others. A personal coach will guide you in the process of realizing your personal goals for becoming a better coach, manager and/or person.
Due to our ‘Cruyffian’ style of learning, students of the Master in Coaching will gain insight into their own strengths and opportunities for improvement as a coach (that they will develop during the program), and their athletes/employees, with the aim to have a better understanding in order to improve performance.
LEARNING MODEL
The Master in Coaching in Amsterdam averages around 10-16 students per year.
The Johan Cruyff Institute uses a rich learning environment that fosters educational tools based on a student interaction model, which also enables students to share their unique experiences and learn from each other. Students will engage actively in creative challenges that require effort, commitment and intuitive thinking.
Throughout the academic year, we focus on the personal development of each student. The professors and staff ensure that everyone is challenged in their learning. All theory will be relevant, tangible, fun and enjoyable to learn through the discussion of case studies by professors and students.
ADMISSION REQUIREMENTS
To be admitted to the Master in Coaching, you must have at least three years of professional experience as a (sport) coach or manager / supervisor. Experience as an elite athlete is not required for this program, but having developed a career as a professional athlete will be valued as work experience, depending on level and commitment.
MODALITY
On campus in Amsterdam & distance learning practices, in English or Dutch.
Three full weeks of on campus sessions in May, September and November (might be subject of change). Classes: Monday to Friday 9.30am - 4.30pm, complemented with approximately 140 hours of distance learning and 20 hours of supervision by a personal coach
This Master in Coaching is right for you if:
You’re a sport coach who wishes to further develop your coaching skills to guide athletes to excel in sport and life.
You have built up experience as a coach and you want to develop a professional career in the sport industry.
You are a manager who wishes to further develop your coaching skills from a sport perspective.
You are a manager who wants to develop a career in sport coaching.

The Master program aims for a balanced mix of students with various sport, educational, cultural and/or business backgrounds. This enables the student-coaches to share their unique experiences, which can be very enriching.
LEARNING OUTCOMES
Profound understanding of the principles of leadership, coaching and team dynamics. The ability to effectively handle team dynamics, ‘Building successful teams’.
Profound understanding of the personal coaching style; Continuous reflection on behavior and actions.
The ability to execute professional coaching sessions (individual / team); Performance Coaching, helping others to reach their full potential in any area in their lives.
The ability to coach in any situation: Winning, loosing and under pressure.
The ability to effectively handle the environment, including the media; Professional communication skills.

BENEFITS
Complete: Focus on coaching in and outside sport, such as coaching in academics, the business world and individual coaching, and covering all aspects of coaching, from preparations to debriefing.
Learn to coach according the vision of Johan Cruyff: You can only coach others if you know how to coach yourself.
Practical: Students will be able to understand and apply their own coaching style
to get their team to perform well.
Personal: A personal coach supports the accomplishment of personal goals.

CHARACTERISTICS
Coaching according the vision of Johan Cruyff: You can only coach others if you know how to coach yourself.
Integrated approach: Managing oneself, the players, the team and the environment.
‘Learning-through-action’: Teacher-coaches stimulate active participation.
Multidisciplinary activities, case studies, coach sessions and experience-based learning (group and individual assignments).
Continuous reflection on coaching sessions, behavior and personal coaching style. Continuous reflection on learning processes and accomplished goals. Self-assessment reports and ‘Report of Journey’.
Applying various coaching techniques: Learning by asking, giving feedback, observing without judging, etc.
Developing a personal coaching style in order to effectively coach others.

Prologis is the global leader in logistics real estate. We own, manage and develop high-quality properties in the world’s most vibrant centers of commerce, approximately 72 million square meters in 19 countries. Some of the world’s largest brands (e.g., Amazon, BMW, DHL, FedEx, Pepsi) turn to us because they know an efficient supply chain will make their businesses run better, and a strategic relationship with Prologis will create competitive advantage. As the top ranked U.S. company and sixth overall among the Global 100 Most Sustainable Corporations in the World, we take our global footprint seriously.
Job Title:
Senior People & Culture Business Partner
Company:
Prologis
Senior People & Culture Business Partner
Amsterdam based - supporting our people in the Benelux & Central European Operations, and our Accounting and Fund Management Teams.
Are you ready to reimagine HR’s most misunderstood role: the HRBP?
At Prologis we offer a very entrepreneurial approach to the role of People & Culture Business Partner (HRBP). Based in Amsterdam, our European headquarters, the majority of time is spent working very closely with business partners across Benelux & Central Europe as well as our Accounting and Fund Management teams. You become their trusted advisor, helping them to develop into great leaders and, making them comfortable in operating within our organizational culture.
Are you an unofficial teacher, detective, peacemaker, and career planner?
How does it look like in practice?
To successfully build our leadership talent for the future, you will report into the European VP of HR, work alongside our Talent Acquisition Partner and lead a team of junior HRBP.
Key - you steer away from the traditional HR routes, spend time encouraging a feedback culture and coaching leaders on this matter. You regularly sit with teams to evaluate and improve dynamics while partnering to guarantee the organizational design matches the goals and strategy. You are skilled with understanding the business in which the partner operates and will advise taking in consideration all company’s aspects and not only their subject expertise.
You strive and love building “adult relationships”, before introducing any HR activity in the organization. Your motto is “what are we trying to solve with it?”, and are more than permitted to use very untraditional approaches. Our People & Culture Business Partners come continuously out of their comfort zone.
Are you the experienced person we are looking for?
#LI-LMP
People First
Each of us working at Prologis plays an essential role in the enduring success of our company. We value people who are decisive, courageous and adaptable. While we are one company, locations and departments operate with autonomy and accountability. Individuals take the initiative here.
When you join Prologis, you work shoulder to shoulder with some of the top talent in the industry to do the best work of your career. Every employee belongs. Every employee contributes. Employees advance their careers here.
As a successful global enterprise, Prologis has never lost sight of what matters most, our strong belief that our people are the most important part of our business. And because of that, we provide a generous total rewards package and take a lot of time to focus on quality management and leadership development. People come first here.

Full time

We are looking for an enthusiastic Content Marketing Intern (5-6 months) ready to take on a creative challenge in our Online Marketing Team in Amsterdam. You will focus on the creation of quality content for our brands in France and Belgium (and the Netherlands), therefore we are looking for an intern with excellent French and Dutch writing skills.

Who are we?

Travix is part of Trip.com Group Limited (Nasdaq: TCOM), besides Trip.com, Ctrip, Skyscanner, and Qunar. The group is a leading one-stop travel service provider and one of the largest travel companies in the world.

Travix is one of the leading global online travel agencies with the brands CheapTickets, Vliegwinkel, BudgetAir, Flugladen and Vayama. Our mission is ‘the next journey at your fingertips’, which goes for both customers and employees. We provide extensive search and book capabilities for flights, hotels, rental cars and products such as insurances and parking. With 5 brands in over 40 countries and with over 55 different nationalities employed, a global mindset comes natural to us. Are you ready for a new journey at Travix?

As a Content Marketing Intern, you will:

Learn all the ins & outs in the field of content marketing, SEO, social media, newsletters (and a piece of Google Analytics & Facebook Analytics)
Research and write interesting content for our travel-loving community
Create newsletters
Create campaigns for airlines and tourism boards
Assist with content localization and SEO optimization
Analyze the performance of our Content Marketing efforts with tools such as Google Analytics
Get a lot of responsibility and opportunities to own ideas
Support the Marketing team in various tasks across other marketing channels

This internship is for you if:

You have excellent French and Dutch writing skills
You have excellent English speaking and writing skills
You have basic knowledge of Photoshop (pre)
You are enrolled throughout the entire duration of the internship in a relevant Bachelor or Master degree (not a postgraduate)
You are available to work full-time for at least 5 months
You have a creative mindset exploding with ideas and a great willingness to meticulously learn the art of Content Marketing
You love writing and have excellent storytelling skills as well as a good eye for winning images and creatives
You love travelling and want to inspire others to travel too!
You are organized, self-disciplined, able to manage multiple competing priorities and deliver results under tight deadlines
You are a genuine team player who is not afraid of being professionally challenged

What you can expect:

A laptop to use during your internship
You will be thrown into the deep end and will get real responsibilities from day one!
A mentor who will guide you through your internship
Boost your Content Marketing knowledge through the roof; you will be able to tell your teachers at Uni how SEO strategies and content marketing work in practice
You will learn the tricks and traits of the flight industry from all the different angles, one of the most dynamic markets out there
We love to hear your ideas so there is a good deal of room to be creative and to build your legacy
Become part of a multinational team of specialists to inspire and support you!
Fun (online) team events
Internship allowance of €750 (gross) plus full travel costs between home and office covered


Are you ready to take on this challenge?

Are you the Content Marketing Intern that we are looking for? Take your chance and convince us of your writing talent with your application letter. Apply via the ‘Apply now’ button below.

Building an online platform for educational games for children

Not just a job, but a job with a purpose! Does the idea of making the world a better place appeal to you? So you believe education can change the world in a positive way? And do you think about your own role in this world? Then come work with us!

Squla is a Dutch company building an online platform for educational games, where hundreds of thousands of children, parents and teachers interact.

Interested? Good! Let’s dive into the details of the job and let us tell you more about Squla.

At this moment we are looking for Medior and Senior Full Stack Developers for our teams. Why? Because we would like to keep on developing our product and services so more children can benefit from learning with Squla.

The role of Full Stack Developer at Squla

In this role you will get the opportunity to work within an international team of excellent developers. The dev teams are building the Squla platform which offers educational quizzes and real-time multiplayer games to primary school aged children at home and in the classroom.

If you enjoy taking ownership and responsibility for independently deploying features that have an immediate impact on the product, keep on reading.

The main programming language we use is Python. If you have experience with Python or are interested in working with Python, this role may be a good fit for you.

About the Squla Development team

Our dev team consists of 10 developers, who work together with Product Owners, Designers, Content Specialists and Business Owners to build and make our product better each day. We implement agile processes, including Scrum, continuous integration and a focus on data driven optimisation.

Your typical day at work will involve
Building end-to-end features that contribute to growing the Squla brand, its fun factor and ultimate effectiveness as a learning tool
Taking part in planning sessions
Testing your features and being fully responsible for them when they go live
Working across different projects and programming languages (mainly Python and HTML5/JavaScript)
Troubleshooting live issues

What we offer you

The Futurewhiz office is located in a beautifully renovated office on Weesperplein in the heart of Amsterdam. We work hard, play hard and we have a lot of fun and foster an informal yet professional atmosphere. Fresh fruit, warm lunch, monthly drinks and company events are an important part of our culture. We love self-development, and that is why you will be given an annual learning budget. Every employee is also provided a Macbook and Squla account for life!

The Futurewhiz crew is a dynamic team that is enthusiastic about creating a fun, new way of learning in this ever-evolving digital age. We believe that a positive work environment not only encourages great teamwork, but is key to motivating our team to produce high quality products. We provide our team members with the resources they need to make sure they can do their jobs properly and get the results we aim for. Although our team is diverse and everyone brings their own interests and uniqueness to the table, every single person is excited about the great work Futurewhiz is doing.

Due to the Corona crisis, this position is only open to candidates that are from the EU or currently live in The Netherlands and with a work permit.

How you fit in our Development team
A Bachelors’ or Masters’ degree in Computer Science or equivalent
Exceptional analytical and problem-solving skills
A thorough knowledge of computer science fundamentals (algorithms and data structures)
A good foundation in relational database concepts and practices
The ability to write clean and maintainable code, following standards and guidelines
Fluent in English, both written and spoken
A team player, able to communicate across disciplines
A good understanding of common design patterns
Experience writing automated tests

Bonus points for:
AWS or other cloud experience
Experience with HTML5 games
Experience with Unity

Core Values

Squla believes its 5 'Core Values' are at the heart of what we do and thus form an important part of the DNA of our employees:

Learning is everything

Results matter

Fun works

Together is better

Be brave

These 'Core Values' form an important part in every job interview for all the job vacancies within our organisation.

A Codility test is part of our hiring process.

Who we are:
Jamf, the standard for Apple in the enterprise, extends the legendary Apple experience people love to businesses, schools, and government organizations by simplifying Mac, iPad, iPhone and Apple TV deployment, management and security — anytime, anywhere.


We are a group of curious, self-starters with a passion for helping people make sense of technology – freeing nurses to care, teachers to teach and businesses to thrive. We take pride in making meaningful impact for tens of thousands of customers around the globe, all the while getting to work with the best Apple infrastructure and security platform in the world. We have over 1,300 employees worldwide with offices in the U.S., Europe, Japan, and Australia. To learn more visit: https://www.jamf.com/careers.


What you’ll do at Jamf:
At Jamf, we empower people to be their best selves and do their best work. The BDE for Enterprise System Integrators in EMEIA is responsible for building and cultivating strategic relationships with Jamf’s existing and potential Enterprise System Integrator partners; while working together to expand and accelerate sales, by leveraging the complete Jamf product portfolio (Jamf Pro, Jamf School, Jamf Connect, Jamf Protect). This position is responsible for defining and executing the go-to-market strategy and messaging, for the success of both our SI partners and Jamf, within EMEIA (Europe, Middle East, Africa, India).


Responsibilities

Define and lead Jamf’s Enterprise System Integrator partner strategy in EMEIA
Identify Enterprise System Integrators to partner with and enable the sale of Apple deployments with Jamf’s portfolio. Such partners could include GSI and Carrier-related Business Services channels.
Own senior-level relationship with the partners
Unlock full potential of these partnerships to maximise opportunities within all sales channels at the partner: industry-focused, segment-focused, re-sell, managed service, consultative, etc...
Map partner teams to Jamf teams: sales, enablement, marketing, support, services, etc...
Forge long-term, value-creating relationships to ensure strong, deep partnerships that deliver continued growth
Collaborate with appropriate Jamf teams, to ensure our partners have the required resources and support materials for sales enablement
Drive new revenue of Jamf solutions by providing overlay sales support for Jamf sales teams
Understand and support the needs of Jamf’s Regional Sales Managers in EMEIA, to ensure our Enterprise System Integrators are connected, involved and driving success with our teams

5+ years experience developing new business opportunities at or with Enterprise-level System Integrators (required)
Proven track record of balancing multiple territory needs, differing vertical nuances or product lines
Passion for all things Apple and strong desire to see Apple succeed in the Enterprise
Excellent communication, interpersonal, organisation and presentation skills
Ability to work autonomously with little direction and within a larger team


This role may be based in Amsterdam, London, Munich, Paris or Stockholm


How we help you reach your best potential:

We are progressive, but laid back. You are free to be you and work how you work best. Here, you manage your own day and your own work style.
Our people are what make us great, and we protect our people. Jamfs across the globe receive a superior compensation and benefits package.
Everyone has a voice and everyone can make a difference, our more than 90% employee retention rate agrees!
Opportunity to make a real and meaningful impact for more than 38,000 global customers with the best Apple device management solution in the world.
We put people over profits – which is why our customers keep coming back to us.
Ability to support and give back to your community through volunteer paid time off.
We embrace all perspectives. Our employee led I&D groups encourage employees to make real, actionable differences here at Jamf.
24 of 25 world’s most valuable brands rely on Jamf to do their best work (as ranked by Forbes).
Over 100,000 Jamf Nation users, the largest online IT community in the world.


You are the right kind of Jamf if:
You go above and beyond for others, genuine and willing to help, always. You support the team around you, you don’t point fingers or pass blame. You take responsibility for your actions, are open, and respect others. You value different perspectives, in how you work and how you learn. You are naturally inquisitive, like to create and be creative. You are a problem solver, curious and resourceful, self-driven and constantly improving. You roll up your sleeves and dig in. You are excited by not knowing what may lie ahead. You are willing to take risks, try new things, even fail just to do it better next time. You’re not a jerk. You put people first. You are a good person, someone who just wants to do the right thing.


Why Jamf?
Our mission is simple; we help organizations succeed with Apple. At Jamf, we put people first. We focus on the human before we focus on the technology. We are just good people that have it at their core to do what’s right – for our customers, our employees and our communities.

The Company: Working at Codaisseur

Some call it work. We call it doing what we love — and loving what we do. Technology is everywhere in the world and we believe any motivated person should be able to create it.

We see a gap between what traditional educational institutions teach and what businesses need. We think education should be ever-changing and evolving in order to help bridge that gap, as this is the only way to make sure economies will be ready for the increasing demand in the tech industry.
We dream big, embrace new opportunities, and challenge ourselves every day. We have built a workplace where everyone gets to shine and celebrate their individuality. We do this by accepting and encouraging curiosity, grace, sincerity, excitement, togetherness, and drive.


The project you will be working on:

Codaisseur is growing and becoming ready to scale. We have big plans, backed by years of experience and highly skilled teachers, to expand codaisseur in all kind of ways. One way is to dramatically improve our internal administration system, to create our new student platform and collect all our data in oder to support business decisions. Step 1 is to migrate our stack from Ruby to Elixir, so we can utilise its great capabilities and create a robust platform we can keep on building on top of in the future.


We’re looking for an experienced Elixir developer to help us and bring in the knowledge and skills to help make this a success for the backend side. You will be joining our Product team, which exists of an experienced CTO, a product owner, front-end & full-stack developers, a designer and a lot of passionate skilled people.

The Benefits: You Get:

An inspiring environment where we prioritise diversity and continuous learning
Flexible schedules and work from home options
Full coverage of travel expenses, no matter where you live in The Netherlands
€1K annual budget for coaching and personal & professional development
An increasingly diverse team of 20 passionate and skilled colleagues who are dedicated to filling the talent gap in tech
A workplace 5 minutes’ walking distance from Sloterdijk station in Amsterdam with sitting/standing desks, 4K monitors, and a new MacBook Pro
Free lunch, tea, and coffee
A good salary (€50-75k) depending on your experience.
25 Vacation days per year
Permanent contract plus stock options within 2 years
Anything else we may agree to: feel free to discuss your needs and preferences

You have:


Experienced with Elixir, preferably in production
Experienced with the Phoenix & Absinthe framework
Experienced with Elastic search / Postgres / GraphQL
Enthusiastic, creative, and a good problem-solver
A good communicator in both spoken and written English
Flexible and able to adapt to new situations quickly
Professional and eager to work with the whole team to push our ideas forward
Able to build high-quality, scalable, and test-driven codebases

The Nice to Haves:

Experience with Google Cloud / AWS
Experience with Kubernetes / Docker
Experience with Event Sourcing & CQRS
Experience with React / Typescript

#About Ironhack
Ironhack is an education startup that was founded to disrupt the way tech education works!

Doesn’t it seem odd that we’ve been learning the same way since the Industrial Revolution? Virtually all industries are pushing the limits on how to do things faster, better, and more efficiently. Yet, for the most part, people feel stuck on a 4+ year (and usually quite expensive) path that often results in an unfulfilling career path.

We empower students to create a new path - one that leads to meaningful careers in software development, product design or data analytics in a fraction of the time and cost of traditional education.

Our higher purpose is to transform the education space to be unapologetically outcomes-driven. Whether students are looking to change careers, get a promotion, skip University, or start their own company, we work tirelessly every day to make sure this path is as quick, immersive, and accessible as possible. Hearing these success stories is what gets us out of bed each day, excited to come to work :)

It’s with this mindset that we’ve become one of the key global players in bridging the digital skills gap, serving both those looking to get into tech, as well as the companies hungry for tech talent.

Quick facts:Founded in 2013 by Wharton and Harvard gradsOperations in Miami, Madrid, Barcelona, Paris, Mexico City, Lisbon, Amsterdam, Sao Paulo and Berlin100% YoY Growth (help us to keep it going!)Graduated over 6500 students100+ global team membersVenture capital backed

#About the gig
We are looking for a Full-time Lead Teacher for our UX/UI Design Bootcamp with a passion for user experience design, and also a passion for sharing their knowledge with the next generation of UX/UI designers. You need to be a strong communicator and very patient - you’ll need to be able to explain abstract concepts to first-time designers and walk them through the entire design process.
#Responsibilities
Overseeing the whole academic experience of our Ironhack bootcamps
Teaching at our Amsterdam Campus from Monday to Friday (09:00 to 18:00)
Creating engaging content for our UX/UI Design courses that may include lessons, exercises and/or mini-projects
Managing Teaching Assistants (TA)
