Don't miss the unique opportunity to join our one-of-a-kind team!

EF is committed to safeguarding and promoting the welfare of children and young people. All posts are subject to an enhanced DBS and character reference checks.

We are looking for an enthusiastic Content Marketing Intern (5-6 months) ready to take on a creative challenge in our global online marketing team. You will focus on the creation of quality content for our brands in the UK and the Americas, therefore we are searching for a fluent English speaker. During this internship you will be working from our Amsterdam office.

Who are we?

Travix is part of Trip.com Group Limited (Nasdaq: TCOM), besides Trip.com, Ctrip, Skyscanner, and Qunar. The group is a leading one-stop travel service provider and one of the largest travel companies in the world.

Travix is one of the leading global online travel agencies with the brands CheapTickets, Vliegwinkel, BudgetAir, Flugladen and Vayama. Our mission is ‘the next journey at your fingertips’, which goes for both customers and employees. We provide extensive search and book capabilities for flights, hotels, rental cars and products such as insurances and parking. With 5 brands in over 40 countries and with over 55 different nationalities employed, a global mindset comes natural to us. Are you ready for a new journey at Travix?

As a Content Marketing Intern, you will:

Learn all the ins & outs in the field of content marketing, SEO, social media, newsletters (and a piece of Google Analytics & Facebook Analytics)
Research and write interesting content for our travel-loving community
Create newsletters
Create campaigns for airlines and tourism boards
Assist with content localization and SEO optimization
Analyze the performance of our Content Marketing efforts with tools such as Google Analytics, Google Admanager and Looker
Get a lot of responsibility and opportunities to own ideas
Support the Marketing team in various tasks across other marketing channels

This internship is for you if:

You are a fluent English speaker (Spanish language skills are a plus)
You have basic knowledge of Photoshop
You are enrolled throughout the entire duration of the internship in a relevant field of study (e.g. Marketing, Communication, Journalism)
You are available to work full-time for at least 5 months
You have a creative mindset exploding with ideas and a great willingness to meticulously learn the art of Content Marketing
You love writing and have excellent storytelling skills as well as a good eye for winning images and creatives
You love travelling and want to inspire others to travel too!
You are organized, self-disciplined, able to manage multiple competing priorities and deliver results under tight deadlines
You are eager to learn, hands-on and not afraid to try something new.

What you can expect:

A laptop to use during your internship
You will be thrown into the deep end and will get real responsibilities from day one!
A mentor who will guide you through your internship
Boost your Content Marketing knowledge through the roof; you will be able to tell your teachers at Uni how SEO strategies and content marketing work in practice
You will learn the tricks and traits of the flight industry from all the different angles, one of the most dynamic markets out there
We love to hear your ideas so there is a good deal of room to be creative and to build your legacy
Become part of a multinational team of specialists to inspire and support you!
Fun (online) team events
Internship allowance of €750 (gross) plus full travel costs between home and office covered

About Us

EF Education First is a global education company focusing on language, academic, cultural exchange, and educational travel programs.


We are 52,000 staff, faculty and teachers, working in over 612 offices and schools across 52 countries, and having a global presence in 116 countries. While we continue to grow, we strive to stay small so as to ensure agility, smart thinking and a fun place to work. For the past 53 years, EF has grown to include a range of programs that give students of all ages the freedom and confidence to explore the world through language, travel and education.


EF is committed to safeguarding and promoting the welfare of children and young adults and expects all staff and volunteers to share this commitment. References will be followed up and will ask specifically whether there is any reason that the applicant should not be engaged in situations where they have responsibility for, or substantial access to, persons under 18. Upon interview all gaps in CVs must be explained satisfactorily and proof of identity and, where applicable, qualifications will be required. Appropriate suitability checks and Garda Vetting will be conducted prior to confirmation of appointment.

Each participant’s personal background is a base for further development and better understanding of oneself as a coach and/or manager. The principle of coaching is that you then apply this insight knowledge in counseling others. A personal coach will guide you in the process of realizing your personal goals for becoming a better coach, manager and/or person.
Due to our ‘Cruyffian’ style of learning, students of the Master in Coaching will gain insight into their own strengths and opportunities for improvement as a coach (that they will develop during the program), and their athletes/employees, with the aim to have a better understanding in order to improve performance.
LEARNING MODEL
The Master in Coaching in Amsterdam averages around 10-16 students per year.
The Johan Cruyff Institute uses a rich learning environment that fosters educational tools based on a student interaction model, which also enables students to share their unique experiences and learn from each other. Students will engage actively in creative challenges that require effort, commitment and intuitive thinking.
Throughout the academic year, we focus on the personal development of each student. The professors and staff ensure that everyone is challenged in their learning. All theory will be relevant, tangible, fun and enjoyable to learn through the discussion of case studies by professors and students.
ADMISSION REQUIREMENTS
To be admitted to the Master in Coaching, you must have at least three years of professional experience as a (sport) coach or manager / supervisor. Experience as an elite athlete is not required for this program, but having developed a career as a professional athlete will be valued as work experience, depending on level and commitment.
MODALITY
On campus in Amsterdam & distance learning practices, in English or Dutch.
Three full weeks of on campus sessions in May, September and November (might be subject of change). Classes: Monday to Friday 9.30am - 4.30pm, complemented with approximately 140 hours of distance learning and 20 hours of supervision by a personal coach
This Master in Coaching is right for you if:
You’re a sport coach who wishes to further develop your coaching skills to guide athletes to excel in sport and life.
You have built up experience as a coach and you want to develop a professional career in the sport industry.
You are a manager who wishes to further develop your coaching skills from a sport perspective.
You are a manager who wants to develop a career in sport coaching.

The Master program aims for a balanced mix of students with various sport, educational, cultural and/or business backgrounds. This enables the student-coaches to share their unique experiences, which can be very enriching.
LEARNING OUTCOMES
Profound understanding of the principles of leadership, coaching and team dynamics. The ability to effectively handle team dynamics, ‘Building successful teams’.
Profound understanding of the personal coaching style; Continuous reflection on behavior and actions.
The ability to execute professional coaching sessions (individual / team); Performance Coaching, helping others to reach their full potential in any area in their lives.
The ability to coach in any situation: Winning, loosing and under pressure.
The ability to effectively handle the environment, including the media; Professional communication skills.

BENEFITS
Complete: Focus on coaching in and outside sport, such as coaching in academics, the business world and individual coaching, and covering all aspects of coaching, from preparations to debriefing.
Learn to coach according the vision of Johan Cruyff: You can only coach others if you know how to coach yourself.
Practical: Students will be able to understand and apply their own coaching style
to get their team to perform well.
Personal: A personal coach supports the accomplishment of personal goals.

CHARACTERISTICS
Coaching according the vision of Johan Cruyff: You can only coach others if you know how to coach yourself.
Integrated approach: Managing oneself, the players, the team and the environment.
‘Learning-through-action’: Teacher-coaches stimulate active participation.
Multidisciplinary activities, case studies, coach sessions and experience-based learning (group and individual assignments).
Continuous reflection on coaching sessions, behavior and personal coaching style. Continuous reflection on learning processes and accomplished goals. Self-assessment reports and ‘Report of Journey’.
Applying various coaching techniques: Learning by asking, giving feedback, observing without judging, etc.
Developing a personal coaching style in order to effectively coach others.

Prologis is the global leader in logistics real estate. We own, manage and develop high-quality properties in the world’s most vibrant centers of commerce, approximately 72 million square meters in 19 countries. Some of the world’s largest brands (e.g., Amazon, BMW, DHL, FedEx, Pepsi) turn to us because they know an efficient supply chain will make their businesses run better, and a strategic relationship with Prologis will create competitive advantage. As the top ranked U.S. company and sixth overall among the Global 100 Most Sustainable Corporations in the World, we take our global footprint seriously.
Job Title:
Senior People & Culture Business Partner
Company:
Prologis
Senior People & Culture Business Partner
Amsterdam based - supporting our people in the Benelux & Central European Operations, and our Accounting and Fund Management Teams.
Are you ready to reimagine HR’s most misunderstood role: the HRBP?
At Prologis we offer a very entrepreneurial approach to the role of People & Culture Business Partner (HRBP). Based in Amsterdam, our European headquarters, the majority of time is spent working very closely with business partners across Benelux & Central Europe as well as our Accounting and Fund Management teams. You become their trusted advisor, helping them to develop into great leaders and, making them comfortable in operating within our organizational culture.
Are you an unofficial teacher, detective, peacemaker, and career planner?
How does it look like in practice?
To successfully build our leadership talent for the future, you will report into the European VP of HR, work alongside our Talent Acquisition Partner and lead a team of junior HRBP.
Key - you steer away from the traditional HR routes, spend time encouraging a feedback culture and coaching leaders on this matter. You regularly sit with teams to evaluate and improve dynamics while partnering to guarantee the organizational design matches the goals and strategy. You are skilled with understanding the business in which the partner operates and will advise taking in consideration all company’s aspects and not only their subject expertise.
You strive and love building “adult relationships”, before introducing any HR activity in the organization. Your motto is “what are we trying to solve with it?”, and are more than permitted to use very untraditional approaches. Our People & Culture Business Partners come continuously out of their comfort zone.
Are you the experienced person we are looking for?
#LI-LMP
People First
Each of us working at Prologis plays an essential role in the enduring success of our company. We value people who are decisive, courageous and adaptable. While we are one company, locations and departments operate with autonomy and accountability. Individuals take the initiative here.
When you join Prologis, you work shoulder to shoulder with some of the top talent in the industry to do the best work of your career. Every employee belongs. Every employee contributes. Employees advance their careers here.
As a successful global enterprise, Prologis has never lost sight of what matters most, our strong belief that our people are the most important part of our business. And because of that, we provide a generous total rewards package and take a lot of time to focus on quality management and leadership development. People come first here.

Full time
Location:
Amsterdam, Netherlands
Additional Locations:

We are looking for an enthusiastic Content Marketing Intern (5-6 months) ready to take on a creative challenge in our Online Marketing Team in Amsterdam. You will focus on the creation of quality content for our brands in France and Belgium (and the Netherlands), therefore we are looking for an intern with excellent French and Dutch writing skills.

Who are we?

Travix is part of Trip.com Group Limited (Nasdaq: TCOM), besides Trip.com, Ctrip, Skyscanner, and Qunar. The group is a leading one-stop travel service provider and one of the largest travel companies in the world.

Travix is one of the leading global online travel agencies with the brands CheapTickets, Vliegwinkel, BudgetAir, Flugladen and Vayama. Our mission is ‘the next journey at your fingertips’, which goes for both customers and employees. We provide extensive search and book capabilities for flights, hotels, rental cars and products such as insurances and parking. With 5 brands in over 40 countries and with over 55 different nationalities employed, a global mindset comes natural to us. Are you ready for a new journey at Travix?

As a Content Marketing Intern, you will:

Learn all the ins & outs in the field of content marketing, SEO, social media, newsletters (and a piece of Google Analytics & Facebook Analytics)
Research and write interesting content for our travel-loving community
Create newsletters
Create campaigns for airlines and tourism boards
Assist with content localization and SEO optimization
Analyze the performance of our Content Marketing efforts with tools such as Google Analytics
Get a lot of responsibility and opportunities to own ideas
Support the Marketing team in various tasks across other marketing channels

This internship is for you if:

You have excellent French and Dutch writing skills
You have excellent English speaking and writing skills
You have basic knowledge of Photoshop (pre)
You are enrolled throughout the entire duration of the internship in a relevant Bachelor or Master degree (not a postgraduate)
You are available to work full-time for at least 5 months
You have a creative mindset exploding with ideas and a great willingness to meticulously learn the art of Content Marketing
You love writing and have excellent storytelling skills as well as a good eye for winning images and creatives
You love travelling and want to inspire others to travel too!
You are organized, self-disciplined, able to manage multiple competing priorities and deliver results under tight deadlines
You are a genuine team player who is not afraid of being professionally challenged

What you can expect:

A laptop to use during your internship
You will be thrown into the deep end and will get real responsibilities from day one!
A mentor who will guide you through your internship
Boost your Content Marketing knowledge through the roof; you will be able to tell your teachers at Uni how SEO strategies and content marketing work in practice
You will learn the tricks and traits of the flight industry from all the different angles, one of the most dynamic markets out there
We love to hear your ideas so there is a good deal of room to be creative and to build your legacy
Become part of a multinational team of specialists to inspire and support you!
Fun (online) team events
Internship allowance of €750 (gross) plus full travel costs between home and office covered


Are you ready to take on this challenge?

Are you the Content Marketing Intern that we are looking for? Take your chance and convince us of your writing talent with your application letter. Apply via the ‘Apply now’ button below.

Building an online platform for educational games for children

Not just a job, but a job with a purpose! Does the idea of making the world a better place appeal to you? So you believe education can change the world in a positive way? And do you think about your own role in this world? Then come work with us!

Squla is a Dutch company building an online platform for educational games, where hundreds of thousands of children, parents and teachers interact.

Interested? Good! Let’s dive into the details of the job and let us tell you more about Squla.

At this moment we are looking for Medior and Senior Full Stack Developers for our teams. Why? Because we would like to keep on developing our product and services so more children can benefit from learning with Squla.

The role of Full Stack Developer at Squla

In this role you will get the opportunity to work within an international team of excellent developers. The dev teams are building the Squla platform which offers educational quizzes and real-time multiplayer games to primary school aged children at home and in the classroom.

If you enjoy taking ownership and responsibility for independently deploying features that have an immediate impact on the product, keep on reading.

The main programming language we use is Python. If you have experience with Python or are interested in working with Python, this role may be a good fit for you.

About the Squla Development team

Our dev team consists of 10 developers, who work together with Product Owners, Designers, Content Specialists and Business Owners to build and make our product better each day. We implement agile processes, including Scrum, continuous integration and a focus on data driven optimisation.

Your typical day at work will involve
Building end-to-end features that contribute to growing the Squla brand, its fun factor and ultimate effectiveness as a learning tool
Taking part in planning sessions
Testing your features and being fully responsible for them when they go live
Working across different projects and programming languages (mainly Python and HTML5/JavaScript)
Troubleshooting live issues

What we offer you

The Futurewhiz office is located in a beautifully renovated office on Weesperplein in the heart of Amsterdam. We work hard, play hard and we have a lot of fun and foster an informal yet professional atmosphere. Fresh fruit, warm lunch, monthly drinks and company events are an important part of our culture. We love self-development, and that is why you will be given an annual learning budget. Every employee is also provided a Macbook and Squla account for life!

The Futurewhiz crew is a dynamic team that is enthusiastic about creating a fun, new way of learning in this ever-evolving digital age. We believe that a positive work environment not only encourages great teamwork, but is key to motivating our team to produce high quality products. We provide our team members with the resources they need to make sure they can do their jobs properly and get the results we aim for. Although our team is diverse and everyone brings their own interests and uniqueness to the table, every single person is excited about the great work Futurewhiz is doing.

Due to the Corona crisis, this position is only open to candidates that are from the EU or currently live in The Netherlands and with a work permit.

How you fit in our Development team
A Bachelors’ or Masters’ degree in Computer Science or equivalent
Exceptional analytical and problem-solving skills
A thorough knowledge of computer science fundamentals (algorithms and data structures)
A good foundation in relational database concepts and practices
The ability to write clean and maintainable code, following standards and guidelines
Fluent in English, both written and spoken
A team player, able to communicate across disciplines
A good understanding of common design patterns
Experience writing automated tests

Bonus points for:
AWS or other cloud experience
Experience with HTML5 games
Experience with Unity

Core Values

Squla believes its 5 'Core Values' are at the heart of what we do and thus form an important part of the DNA of our employees:

Learning is everything

Results matter

Fun works

Together is better

Be brave

These 'Core Values' form an important part in every job interview for all the job vacancies within our organisation.

A Codility test is part of our hiring process.

Due to the Corona crisis, this position is only open to candidates that currently live in The Netherlands and have a work permit.

Who we are:
Jamf, the standard for Apple in the enterprise, extends the legendary Apple experience people love to businesses, schools, and government organizations by simplifying Mac, iPad, iPhone and Apple TV deployment, management and security — anytime, anywhere.


We are a group of curious, self-starters with a passion for helping people make sense of technology – freeing nurses to care, teachers to teach and businesses to thrive. We take pride in making meaningful impact for tens of thousands of customers around the globe, all the while getting to work with the best Apple infrastructure and security platform in the world. We have over 1,300 employees worldwide with offices in the U.S., Europe, Japan, and Australia. To learn more visit: https://www.jamf.com/careers.


What you’ll do at Jamf:
At Jamf, we empower people to be their best selves and do their best work. The BDE for Enterprise System Integrators in EMEIA is responsible for building and cultivating strategic relationships with Jamf’s existing and potential Enterprise System Integrator partners; while working together to expand and accelerate sales, by leveraging the complete Jamf product portfolio (Jamf Pro, Jamf School, Jamf Connect, Jamf Protect). This position is responsible for defining and executing the go-to-market strategy and messaging, for the success of both our SI partners and Jamf, within EMEIA (Europe, Middle East, Africa, India).


Responsibilities

Define and lead Jamf’s Enterprise System Integrator partner strategy in EMEIA
Identify Enterprise System Integrators to partner with and enable the sale of Apple deployments with Jamf’s portfolio. Such partners could include GSI and Carrier-related Business Services channels.
Own senior-level relationship with the partners
Unlock full potential of these partnerships to maximise opportunities within all sales channels at the partner: industry-focused, segment-focused, re-sell, managed service, consultative, etc...
Map partner teams to Jamf teams: sales, enablement, marketing, support, services, etc...
Forge long-term, value-creating relationships to ensure strong, deep partnerships that deliver continued growth
Collaborate with appropriate Jamf teams, to ensure our partners have the required resources and support materials for sales enablement
Drive new revenue of Jamf solutions by providing overlay sales support for Jamf sales teams
Understand and support the needs of Jamf’s Regional Sales Managers in EMEIA, to ensure our Enterprise System Integrators are connected, involved and driving success with our teams

5+ years experience developing new business opportunities at or with Enterprise-level System Integrators (required)
Proven track record of balancing multiple territory needs, differing vertical nuances or product lines
Passion for all things Apple and strong desire to see Apple succeed in the Enterprise
Excellent communication, interpersonal, organisation and presentation skills
Ability to work autonomously with little direction and within a larger team


This role may be based in Amsterdam, London, Munich, Paris or Stockholm


How we help you reach your best potential:

We are progressive, but laid back. You are free to be you and work how you work best. Here, you manage your own day and your own work style.
Our people are what make us great, and we protect our people. Jamfs across the globe receive a superior compensation and benefits package.
Everyone has a voice and everyone can make a difference, our more than 90% employee retention rate agrees!
Opportunity to make a real and meaningful impact for more than 38,000 global customers with the best Apple device management solution in the world.
We put people over profits – which is why our customers keep coming back to us.
Ability to support and give back to your community through volunteer paid time off.
We embrace all perspectives. Our employee led I&D groups encourage employees to make real, actionable differences here at Jamf.
24 of 25 world’s most valuable brands rely on Jamf to do their best work (as ranked by Forbes).
Over 100,000 Jamf Nation users, the largest online IT community in the world.


You are the right kind of Jamf if:
You go above and beyond for others, genuine and willing to help, always. You support the team around you, you don’t point fingers or pass blame. You take responsibility for your actions, are open, and respect others. You value different perspectives, in how you work and how you learn. You are naturally inquisitive, like to create and be creative. You are a problem solver, curious and resourceful, self-driven and constantly improving. You roll up your sleeves and dig in. You are excited by not knowing what may lie ahead. You are willing to take risks, try new things, even fail just to do it better next time. You’re not a jerk. You put people first. You are a good person, someone who just wants to do the right thing.


Why Jamf?
Our mission is simple; we help organizations succeed with Apple. At Jamf, we put people first. We focus on the human before we focus on the technology. We are just good people that have it at their core to do what’s right – for our customers, our employees and our communities.

The Company: Working at Codaisseur

Some call it work. We call it doing what we love — and loving what we do. Technology is everywhere in the world and we believe any motivated person should be able to create it.

We see a gap between what traditional educational institutions teach and what businesses need. We think education should be ever-changing and evolving in order to help bridge that gap, as this is the only way to make sure economies will be ready for the increasing demand in the tech industry.
We dream big, embrace new opportunities, and challenge ourselves every day. We have built a workplace where everyone gets to shine and celebrate their individuality. We do this by accepting and encouraging curiosity, grace, sincerity, excitement, togetherness, and drive.


The project you will be working on:

Codaisseur is growing and becoming ready to scale. We have big plans, backed by years of experience and highly skilled teachers, to expand codaisseur in all kind of ways. One way is to dramatically improve our internal administration system, to create our new student platform and collect all our data in oder to support business decisions. Step 1 is to migrate our stack from Ruby to Elixir, so we can utilise its great capabilities and create a robust platform we can keep on building on top of in the future.


We’re looking for an experienced Elixir developer to help us and bring in the knowledge and skills to help make this a success for the backend side. You will be joining our Product team, which exists of an experienced CTO, a product owner, front-end & full-stack developers, a designer and a lot of passionate skilled people.

The Benefits: You Get:

An inspiring environment where we prioritise diversity and continuous learning
Flexible schedules and work from home options
Full coverage of travel expenses, no matter where you live in The Netherlands
€1K annual budget for coaching and personal & professional development
An increasingly diverse team of 20 passionate and skilled colleagues who are dedicated to filling the talent gap in tech
A workplace 5 minutes’ walking distance from Sloterdijk station in Amsterdam with sitting/standing desks, 4K monitors, and a new MacBook Pro
Free lunch, tea, and coffee
A good salary (€50-75k) depending on your experience.
25 Vacation days per year
Permanent contract plus stock options within 2 years
Anything else we may agree to: feel free to discuss your needs and preferences

You have:


Experienced with Elixir, preferably in production
Experienced with the Phoenix & Absinthe framework
Experienced with Elastic search / Postgres / GraphQL
Enthusiastic, creative, and a good problem-solver
A good communicator in both spoken and written English
Flexible and able to adapt to new situations quickly
Professional and eager to work with the whole team to push our ideas forward
Able to build high-quality, scalable, and test-driven codebases

The Nice to Haves:

Experience with Google Cloud / AWS
Experience with Kubernetes / Docker
Experience with Event Sourcing & CQRS
Experience with React / Typescript

#About Ironhack
Ironhack is an education startup that was founded to disrupt the way tech education works!

Doesn’t it seem odd that we’ve been learning the same way since the Industrial Revolution? Virtually all industries are pushing the limits on how to do things faster, better, and more efficiently. Yet, for the most part, people feel stuck on a 4+ year (and usually quite expensive) path that often results in an unfulfilling career path.

We empower students to create a new path - one that leads to meaningful careers in software development, product design or data analytics in a fraction of the time and cost of traditional education.

Our higher purpose is to transform the education space to be unapologetically outcomes-driven. Whether students are looking to change careers, get a promotion, skip University, or start their own company, we work tirelessly every day to make sure this path is as quick, immersive, and accessible as possible. Hearing these success stories is what gets us out of bed each day, excited to come to work :)

It’s with this mindset that we’ve become one of the key global players in bridging the digital skills gap, serving both those looking to get into tech, as well as the companies hungry for tech talent.

Quick facts:Founded in 2013 by Wharton and Harvard gradsOperations in Miami, Madrid, Barcelona, Paris, Mexico City, Lisbon, Amsterdam, Sao Paulo and Berlin100% YoY Growth (help us to keep it going!)Graduated over 6500 students100+ global team membersVenture capital backed

#About the gig
We are looking for a Full-time Lead Teacher for our UX/UI Design Bootcamp with a passion for user experience design, and also a passion for sharing their knowledge with the next generation of UX/UI designers. You need to be a strong communicator and very patient - you’ll need to be able to explain abstract concepts to first-time designers and walk them through the entire design process.
#Responsibilities
Overseeing the whole academic experience of our Ironhack bootcamps
Teaching at our Amsterdam Campus from Monday to Friday (09:00 to 18:00)
Creating engaging content for our UX/UI Design courses that may include lessons, exercises and/or mini-projects
Managing Teaching Assistants (TA)
Lead instructor will not need to produce the curriculum. The curriculum is pre-made.
#Is this you? (Requirements)
3-5+ years of design experience in the UX/UI industry, preferably in a leadership role

#Technologies & skills with good understanding of:
UX/UI design process and design thinking methodology
UX/UI best practices
UX strategy & research
Information Architecture
Design patterns and heuristics
Strong visual design skills
Typography, colors, layouts, grids, style guides
Proficient with Figma design software (or related technology)
Familiar with scalable design systems
Prototyping tools - InVision
Usability testing

Job Title: Lead Designer, Content Production for Automotive Industry
Job Description:
MediaMonks is hiring a brilliant and thoughtful hands–on Lead Designer to guide design teams in crafting top–notch content for an exciting automotive account.

What you’ll do

Lead, build and manage a team of international designers that craft amazing work for the world’s biggest brands. You will be a defining voice on the art– and design direction of your projects, working in close collaboration with a creative director or design director in your local team.
Translate brand values, creative concepts, UX documentation and user–stories into functional and expressive design solutions by yourself, and brief and review designers on producing these designs.
Working for a specific client with an internal team you’ll ensure we’re going above and beyond the original brief to push what’s possible on both a creative and technical level.
Employing your problem–solving skills and full stack of design solutions to guide projects and design teams from start, finish and everywhere in between to ensure the highest quality of the delivery.
Present and substantiate the work created by you and/or your design team in person or through video calls when working on pitches and proposals, or during production. You’ll direct (or create) prototypes and/or animations of designs where needed to provide additional clarification.
Provide verbal and written (narrative driven) conceptual thinking and design rationale to articulate and strengthen your (and your team’s) proposals.
Have opinions and not be afraid to voice them.

Requirements:
Become our new Lead Designer
Working at MediaMonks means you’ll be part of a fun, successful and fast-moving company that constantly pushes the envelope when it comes to creative production. Challenges are part of the job, but so is our casual company culture. If you meet and exceed this profile, we’d love to meet you.

What you’ll bring

You’re a natural design leader and teacher, with a great instinct and proven track record for fostering, growing, educating, motivating, and retaining a team of creative designers.

Next to this you’re a great designer yourself and you don’t mind getting your hands dirty. You prove your visual prowess through your online portfolio and relevant working experience of around 10 years across the field of digital and web design. Beyond aesthetic excellence, your portfolio demonstrates exemplary presentation, research, troubleshooting and problem–solving skills.

Your unwavering curiosity never stops you from learning and progressing. You love pushing the envelope both personally and professionally.
You love people and their diversity. You’re great to work with, as you have strong social and communication skills that ensure you understand how colleagues and clients work and think.
A feel for the politics of advertising and pitfalls of production.
A critical eye but you’re not critical. You understand that a combination of kudos and critique makes people want to go the extra mile.
A thorough understanding of design fundamentals such as typography, interaction design and usability, grid systems, white space, aspect ratios and colour theory, tying all of these elements together with obsessive attention to detail.
You feel confident in tackling high–end projects in collaboration with colleagues and clients alike.
Mastery of all modern design and prototyping tools (Adobe CS, Sketch, Figma, Principle…). You’re tidy, and you know how to organise your files, layers and folders to make the lives of colleagues easier.
Based on your experience and expertise, you can judge on the quality of the user experience, and explain what needs to be achieved to make it better.
Mindful of your time, budget and schedule, you are flexible and willing to put in the time and dedication needed to make each project you and your team work on a success.

MediaMonks is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to equal opportunity for all employees and applicants. The Company recruits, hires, trains, promotes, compensates, and administers all personnel actions without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sex stereotyping (including assumptions about a person’s appearance or behavior, gender roles, gender expression, or gender identity), pregnancy (which includes pregnancy, childbirth, and medical conditions related to pregnancy, childbirth, or breastfeeding), gender, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, age, mental or physical disability, ancestry, medical condition, marital status, military or veteran status, citizenship status, sexual orientation, genetic information, or any other status protected by applicable law.

Aan de slag als Digital Assistent Floormanager in Amsterdam?
Bent u multi-inzetbaar, zorgvuldig en digitaal vaardig? Bij 65plus In het Onderwijs zijn wij op zoek naar AOW-gerechtigde kandidaten die willen werken als Assistent Floormanager bij een middelbare school, MBO, HBO of universiteit. Bekijk de volledige vacature en solliciteer.

Wat gaat u doen?
De Assistent Floormanager Digitaal Toetsen heeft een essentiële rol en vormt de spil tussen faculteiten, ondersteunende diensten en externe partijen tijdens de afname van digitale toetsen. Hierbij werkt u nauw samen met docenten, ICT-ondersteuners en surveillanten en heeft u een coördinerende rol tijdens het afnemen van een examen. Samen met de faculteiten en de Floormanager waarborgt u de kwaliteit en betrouwbaarheid van het proces rondom de afname van de toetsen. U ziet toe op het naleven van de geldende regels, afspraken en procedures.

Wat verwachten wij van u als Assistent Floormanager?
Als Assistent Floormanager kunt u via ons worden ingezet bij het voortgezet onderwijs, mbo, hbo en/of universiteit. Het is een pre als u ervaring heeft in het hoger onderwijs met relevante kennis en ervaring met de inzet en werking van digitale toetsapplicaties en classroom management software.
Verder heeft u ervaring met het gebruik van ICT-middelen in brede zin en goede kennis van de MS-Office software in het bijzonder. De werktijden variëren van 08:00 tot 22:00 en vereisen een flexibele inzet voornamelijk tijdens de piekweken.
U bent communicatief sterkUitleg geven aan grote groepen is voor u geen probleemU heeft een sterk verantwoordelijkheidsgevoelU bent in staat om prioriteiten te stellen door hoofd- en bijzaken te onderscheidenU beschikt over aantoonbare computervaardighedenU beschikt over een sterk ontwikkeld gevoel voor dienstverleningU werkt uitstekend in teamverbandU beschikt over uitstekende communicatieve vaardigheden in het Nederlands en Engels en kan dit toepassen via de mail, telefoon en helpdesk software.

Over 65plus In het Onderwijs
Maak kennis met 65plus In het Onderwijs, dé arbeidsbemiddelaar in de onderwijssector. Al sinds 1975 plaatsen wij onderwijsmedewerkers bij uiteenlopende onderwijsinstellingen in Nederland, zoals basisscholen, middelbare scholen en het beroepsonderwijs. Ook plaatsen wij onderwijsmedewerkers in het volwassenenonderwijs en het speciaal onderwijs (remedial teachers). In ons bestand hebben wij examinatoren, surveillanten, beoordelaars, docenten, huiswerkbegeleiders, conciërges, receptionisten, klusjesmannen en schoonmakers. Afhankelijk van de functie beschikken de medewerkers over lesbevoegdheden.

Solliciteer nú
Voldoet u aan het functieprofiel en wilt u graag aan de slag als assistent floormanager? Solliciteer direct via de ‘solliciteer button’ of door contact op te nemen met ons regiokantoor Noord-Holland in Zaandam. Bel naar 020 610 56 02 of stuur een e-mail naar planningamsterdam@65plus.nl. Geef bij uw sollicitatie duidelijk aan in welk vakgebied u ervaring heeft, welke werkzaamheden u eerder heeft uitgevoerd en wat uw beschikbaarheid is.

Wilt u graag aan de slag, maar zoekt u net een andere functie? Wij hebben diverse (soortgelijke) vacatures! Bekijk de vacatures van onze specialisaties In het Onderwijs, Op de Weg en In Goede Handen of schrijf u vrijblijvend in.

Functie omschrijving
Onze 23 leerlingen van groep 1/2 van de Visserschool zijn op zoek naar een parttime juf of meester. Omschrijving organisatie:
Als AMOS (Amsterdamse Oecumenische Scholengroep) hebben we de ambitie om onze 7.500 leerlingen het best mogelijke onderwijs te bieden dat toegesneden is op de behoefte van elk individueel kind. Met ruim 650 collega's op 28 scholen (31 locaties) in de stad Amsterdam werken we elke dag weer aan het handen en voeten geven aan deze ambitie, daarin ondersteund door ons bestuurskantoor. Om dat te bereiken werken we tevens samen met andere partijen, zoals andere schoolbesturen, de gemeente en organisaties die meehelpen het onderwijs steeds weer beter en uitdagender te maken. De ontwikkeling van iedere leerling die aan een AMOS-school wordt toevertrouwd, staat voorop. Als oecumenische scholengroep staat AMOS open voor alle geloofsovertuigingen. Dat doen wij vanuit vijf uitgangspunten:- Ieder mens is uniek en van waarde- het gaat om heel de mens- de mens is in principe op het goede gericht- de mens heeft een eigen verantwoordelijkheid in de wereld- het leven is een kostbaar geschenk

Please apply directly to Heleen van Heemskerck van Beest [heleen.vanheemskerckvanbeest@amosonderwijs.nl]). Plesae call us for more information on 020-618 04 81 or visit our website


Over de school
Op de Visserschool geven we minimaal 30% en maximaal 50% van de tijd les in het Engels. De overige lessen vinden plaats in het Nederlands. Daarmee zijn wij de enige basisschool in Amsterdam die deze vorm van tweetalig onderwijs verzorgt. Dit doen wij inmiddels al 5 jaar, sinds 2014!
Kernwoorden: Groepsleerkracht Amsterdam docent leraar

Wat ga je doen

In de functie als coördinator Masteropleiding Geneeskunde heb je een afwisselend en divers takenpakket. In deze positie ben jij, samen met je collega, verantwoordelijk voor de uitvoering van het masterporgramma. Je geeft functioneel leiding aan de coördinatoren van de verschillende coschappen en bent het aanspreekpunt voor vragen over de uitvoering van het programma door coassistent-opleiders en studenten. Met betrekking tot de kwaliteitszorg werk je mee in de plan-do-act-check cyclus waarbij je de rol hebt om vanuit de evaluatiegegevens actiepunten te formuleren en zorg te dragen voor de uitvoering hiervan. Je begeleidt voorts onderwijsverbeterings- en vernieuwingstrajecten en vertaalt deze – voorzien van jouw advies – naar een optimale uitvoering. Tenslotte denk je mee over docentprofessionalisering en geef je op basis van de onderwijsvernieuwingen adviezen voor docenttrainingen.
Door vertrek van een van de coördinatoren master zijn we op zoek naar een nieuwe coördinator master Geneeskunde die vanaf het voorjaar ons team komt versterken.

Wat we van je verwachten

Wij zoeken een Coördinator masteropleiding Geneeskunde die de volgende kwaliteiten met zich meebrengt:

je bent arts met minimaal twee jaar klinische en/of coachende ervaring;
je hebt praktische ervaring met het onderwijzen;
je bent in het bezit van de Basis Kwalificatie Onderwijs (BKO) of Teach the Teacher (TtT) of bent bereid deze te behalen;
je houdt van uitdagingen, bent stressbestendig en kunt goed prioriteiten stellen;
je hebt improvisatietalent, bent creatief in het bedenken van oplossingen en je kunt onderwerpen vanuit diverse invalshoeken benaderen;
je beschikt over goede communicatieve vaardigheden en hebt een heldere wijze van presenteren;
je bent besluitvaardig en je hebt leidinggevende capaciteiten.
Indien je onderwijskundige ervaring en/of werkervaring in de patiëntenzorg hebt, geniet dat sterk onze voorkeur.

Waar ga je werken

De faculteit der geneeskunde VU is verantwoordelijke voor de Bachelor en Masteropleiding Geneeskunde, de Cardiovascular researchmaster, de master Oncology, de master epidemiologie en de HBO master hoger gezondheidszorg onderwijs. De masteropleiding Geneeskunde VU staat onder leiding van het hoofd master Geneeskunde VU die wordt ondersteund door twee coördinatoren master. Zij zijn verantwoordelijk voor de dagelijkse gang van zaken in de drie jarige masteropleiding en ook voor het goed verlopen van de plan-doe-check-act (PDCA) cyclus van onderwijs en toetsing. Daarnaast zijn ze inhoudelijk deskundig op zowel het gebied van onderwijsontwikkeling en uitvoering als op het gebied van de inhoud van de geneeskundeopleiding.

Kijk voor meer informatie op onze website en volg ons op Instagram!

Wat we je bieden

Salarisschaal 12: 4763 tot 6122 euro bruto bij een fulltime dienstverband (afhankelijk van opleiding en ervaring).

Naast een goed basissalaris bieden we onder andere 8,3% eindejaarsuitkering en 8% vakantietoeslag. Wil jij weten wat je gaat verdienen? Bereken dan hier jouw netto salaris (onder voorbehoud).
Gratis en onbeperkt toegang tot het trainingsaanbod van onze online leeromgeving GoodHabitz.
Je pensioen wordt opgebouwd bij het ABP. Amsterdam UMC draagt 70% van deze premie bij.
Wij vergoeden 75% van je OV reiskosten en bieden daarnaast een fietsregeling.
In eerste instantie bieden wij jou een jaarcontract, met uitzicht op een vast dienstverband.
Bij gebleken gelijke geschiktheid krijgen interne kandidaten voorrang op externe kandidaten.
Voor meer informatie over onze arbeidsvoorwaarden kijk op onze website.

Een referentiecheck kan onderdeel zijn van de selectieprocedure. Daarnaast is het aanvragen van een VOG (Verklaring Omtrent Gedrag) voor iedere nieuwe medewerker verplicht. De aanvraag voor een VOG wordt opgestart vanuit VUmc zodra de nieuwe medewerker is aangesteld.
Voor medewerkers die in de directe patiëntzorg gaan werken, kan een uitgebreide screening onderdeel zijn van de procedure. Klik hier voor meer informatie en of deze op jou van toepassing is.
Ben je werkzaam in een zorggerelateerde functie, dan is een aanstellingskeuring ook onderdeel van jouw selectieprocedure.

Bijzonderheden

De selectiegesprekken vinden online plaats in de 2e/3e week van febuari. We streven er naar om de procedure voor 1 maart af te ronden.

Voor meer informatie kun jij jouw vragen richten aan Mevr. Reefman of Mevr. Daelmans via master.gnk@vumc.nl.

Who we are:
Jamf, the standard for Apple in the enterprise, extends the legendary Apple experience people love to businesses, schools, and government organizations by simplifying Mac, iPad, iPhone and Apple TV deployment, management and security — anytime, anywhere.


We are a group of curious, self-starters with a passion for helping people make sense of technology – freeing nurses to care, teachers to teach and businesses to thrive. We take pride in making meaningful impact for tens of thousands of customers around the globe, all the while getting to work with the best Apple infrastructure and security platform in the world. We have over 1,300 employees worldwide with offices in the U.S., Europe, Japan, and Australia. To learn more visit: https://www.jamf.com/careers.


What you’ll do at Jamf:
At Jamf, we empower people to be their best selves and do their best work. The primary role of the Jamf Systems Engineer (Also known as a Sales Engineer) is to partner with other members of the Jamf inside sales team in order to achieve team sales goals. This position will provide technical pre-sales enablement for channel partners. The overall goal is to increase sales revenue for Jamf products across the EMEIA region.


Responsibilities

Be the technical point of contact for prospective and existing customers throughout the sales process.
Work with our channel partners to train and enable them on Jamf products and processes.
Work jointly with the inside sales team on strategy & discovery sessions, in order to understand customer requirements, and develop targeted technical solutions with unique business value.
Demonstrate Jamf products to prospective customers and partners, either remotely or directly on site.
Support product evaluations, proof of concept, and pilot implementations of Jamf solutions to timely success.
Identify the ongoing service needs of customers and recommend support and service engagements in order to ensure customer success.
Support the sales team in achieving revenue and billings goals while maintaining a high level of customer satisfaction.
Represent Jamf by presenting at conferences, events, community groups and roadshows.
Assist the global SE team via product testing and knowledge sharing.


Bachelor’s Degree preferred
Native or full proficiency of business English (Required)
2 years+ in technical sales, support or services experiences (Required)
At least one of the following is required:
Proficient with Apple technology within a business or education environment.
Jamf or MDM industry experience
Experience with presenting/speaking to an audience on technical topics
Travel: up to 50%


How we help you reach your best potential:

We are progressive, but laid back. You are free to be you and work how you work best. Here, you manage your own day and your own work style.
Our people are what make us great, and we protect our people. Jamfs across the globe receive a superior compensation and benefits package.
Everyone has a voice and everyone can make a difference, our more than 90% employee retention rate agrees!
Opportunity to make a real and meaningful impact for more than 38,000 global customers with the best Apple device management solution in the world.
We put people over profits – which is why our customers keep coming back to us.
We embrace all perspectives. Our employee led I&D groups encourage employees to make real, actionable differences here at Jamf.
24 of 25 world’s most valuable brands rely on Jamf to do their best work (as ranked by Forbes).
Over 100,000 Jamf Nation users, the largest online IT community in the world.


You are the right kind of Jamf if:
You go above and beyond for others, genuine and willing to help, always. You support the team around you, you don’t point fingers or pass blame. You take responsibility for your actions, are open, and respect others. You value different perspectives, in how you work and how you learn. You are naturally inquisitive, like to create and be creative. You are a problem solver, curious and resourceful, self-driven and constantly improving. You roll up your sleeves and dig in. You are excited by not knowing what may lie ahead. You are willing to take risks, try new things, even fail just to do it better next time. You’re not a jerk. You put people first. You are a good person, someone who just wants to do the right thing.


Why Jamf?
Our mission is simple; we help organizations succeed with Apple. At Jamf, we put people first. We focus on the human before we focus on the technology. We are just good people that have it at their core to do what’s right – for our customers, our employees and our communities.


Get social with us: Instagram, LinkedIn, & Facebook

Follow the conversation at #onejamf

Aan de slag als surveillant in Amstelveen?
Bent u multi-inzetbaar, zorgvuldig én deskundig? Bij 65plus In het Onderwijs zijn wij geregeld op zoek naar AOW-medewerkers die willen werken als surveillant bij een middelbare school, mbo, hbo of universiteit. Zo zoeken wij momenteel voor een opdrachtgever in de omgeving Amstelveen een ervaren en gemotiveerde surveillant. Naast het uitdelen en innemen van de toets papieren horen taken als identiteitscontrole, controle op hulpmiddelen, toezicht houden en begeleiden van studenten tot uw takenpakket. U realiseert zich dat de student een groot belang heeft bij het halen van een goed cijfer en ervan uit gaat dat de toets in alle rust en conform de juiste protocollen verloopt. U draagt er zorg voor dat deze situatie wordt gewaarborgd en bent rustig en respectvol in uw communicatie. Enthousiast? Bekijk de volledige vacature en solliciteer.
Wat gaat u doen?
Ter ondersteuning van de surveillantenpool is onze opdrachtgever in Amsterdam op zoek naar een ervaren en deskundige man of vrouw die als surveillant wil werken. In deze functie zal u de volgende werkzaamheden uitvoeren:
Ontvangen van studenten en begeleiden naar toets ruimte.
Identiteitsbewijs controleren.
Tentamens uitdelen en innemen.
Alert zijn op spieken en andere fraude mogelijkheden.
Administratieve afwikkeling en inleveren van de tentamens.
Wat verwachten wij van u als surveillant?
Als surveillant kunt u via ons worden ingezet bij het voortgezet onderwijs, mbo, hbo en/of universiteit. Wij werken met roosters waarbij u gedurende een studiejaar gemiddeld elke 6 weken ingezet kunt worden op diensten. Uiteraard krijgt u van ons de juiste instructies om uw werk te kunnen uitvoeren. Heeft u nog geen ervaring met surveilleren dan wordt u ook ingewerkt door een ervaren surveillant. U bent medeverantwoordelijk voor een goed en eerlijk verloop van het tentamen, examen of ander toets moment. Wij verwachten van u dat in de tentamenperioden meerdere dagen beschikbaar bent en dat u zich flexibel opstelt tijdens de uitvoering van uw werkzaamheden. U dient er rekening mee te houden dat het surveilleren bij elke onderwijsvorm of opleiding anders kan zijn georganiseerd.
Wie zoekt 65plus In het Onderwijs?
Als surveillant kunt u aan de slag gaan bij een middelbare school, mbo, hbo of universiteit. U bent medeverantwoordelijk voor een goed en eerlijk verloop van het tentamen, examen of ander toetsingsmoment. U bent hierbij breed inzetbaar, want uw werkzaamheden bestaan onder andere uit het uitdelen en innemen van examen- of tentamenpapieren en het doen van identiteitscontroles en controles van hulpmiddelen. Naast multi-inzetbaar bent u ook zorgvuldig en deskundig; u zorgt voor een betrouwbare, valide én transparante toetsing en handhaaft hierbij de criteria van de examencommissie.
U bent woonachtig in de omgeving van Amsterdam.
U bent digitaal vaardig.
U bent flexibel inzetbaar in werktijden en op locaties.
U heeft een goede lichamelijke fitheid, zoals vier uur kunnen staan/lopen.
U heeft een verzorgde en representatieve uitstraling.
U bent collegiaal en kunt tevens zelfstandig werken.
U heeft gevoel en begrip voor hiërarchische verhoudingen tijdens het werk.
U beschikt over inlevings- en aanpassingsvermogen.
U kunt volgens wisselende instructies op een respectvolle manier orde en regels handhaven.
U bent minimaal 3 dagen per week beschikbaar (1-3 diensten per dag) in de vaste tentamenperioden.
Over 65plus In het Onderwijs
Maak kennis met 65plus In het Onderwijs, dé arbeidsbemiddelaar in de onderwijssector. Al sinds 1975 plaatsen wij onderwijsmedewerkers bij uiteenlopende onderwijsinstellingen in Nederland, zoals basisscholen, middelbare scholen en het beroepsonderwijs. Ook plaatsen wij onderwijsmedewerkers in het volwassenenonderwijs en het speciaal onderwijs (remedial teachers). In ons bestand hebben wij examinatoren, surveillanten, beoordelaars, docenten, huiswerkbegeleiders, conciërges, receptionisten, klusjesmannen en schoonmakers. Afhankelijk van de functie beschikken de medewerkers over lesbevoegdheden.
Solliciteer direct
Voldoet u aan het functieprofiel en wilt u graag aan de slag als surveillant? Aarzel niet en solliciteer vandaag nog via de ‘solliciteer button’ en volg de verdere instructies. Wanneer uw profiel en arbeidswensen aansluiten op de vacature en eisen van onze opdrachtgever, nemen wij telefonisch of per e-mail contact met u op. Heeft u nog vragen over werken via 65plus? Bekijk dan zeker onze veelgestelde vragen (FAQ).

Are you a internationally oriented, ambitious and also collegial scholar in the field of Marketing? Please apply at Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam. Please apply at Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam.


Location: AMSTERDAM

FTE: up to 1.0 fte, also possibilities for part-time
Job description
We are looking for two new colleagues to help us with our teaching needs. The addition of new teachers provides us with an opportunity to further enhance our ambition to be one of the best educational departments in the field, where a collaborative spirit and intellectual curiosity are highly valued. We are looking for ambitious, but also collegial scholars who share our passion for teaching. We are interested in colleagues with a quantitative or marketing strategy background, but also in candidates with a more behavioral profile. Candidates are required to have a PhD in Marketing or related area (either completed or with a fixed date for the defense) at the start of the contract, and should be fluent in English. Being able to speak Dutch is an advantage.


Your duties
Teaching (in English or Dutch) courses on marketing and related topics (including courses and/or tutorials like consumer behavior, behavioral influencing, statistics) in our MSc, BSc and executive programs.
Coordination of courses, and eventually participation in project groups or committees within the Department or Faculty.
Supervising MSc and/or BSc Theses
Requirements
earned or scheduled PhD in marketing or related fields
a demonstrable capacity to teach at the undergraduate, graduate, and post-graduate level.
What are we offering?
A challenging position in a socially involved organization. The salary will be in accordance with university regulations for academic personnel and amounts €2,790 (scale 10) per month during the first year and increases to €5,127 (scale 11) per month during the fourth year, based on a full-time employment. The job profile: is based on the university job ranking system and is vacant for at least 0.2 FTE.


The position involves full time teaching. If necessary, you should be willing to acquire a basic qualification in teaching ('BKO') as demanded by Dutch universities. The position of Lecturer is initially a two-year position, with the possibility of extension.


Additionally, Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam offers excellent fringe benefits and various schemes and regulations to promote a good work/life balance, such as:
a maximum of 41 days of annual leave based on full-time employment
8% holiday allowance and 8.3% end-of-year bonus
solid pension scheme (ABP)
contribution to commuting expense
optional model for designing a personalized benefits package

About Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam
The ambition of Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam is clear: to contribute to a better world through outstanding education and ground-breaking research. We strive to be a university where personal development and commitment to society play a leading role. A university where people from different disciplines and backgrounds collaborate to achieve innovations and to generate new knowledge. Our teaching and research encompass the entire spectrum of academic endeavour – from the humanities, the social sciences and the natural sciences through to the life sciences and the medical sciences.


Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam is home to more than 26,000 students. We employ over 4,600 individuals. The VU campus is easily accessible and located in the heart of Amsterdam’s Zuidas district, a truly inspiring environment for teaching and research.


Diversity

We are an inclusive university community. Diversity is one of our most important values. We believe that engaging in international activities and welcoming students and staff from a wide variety of backgrounds enhances the quality of our education and research. We are always looking for people who can enrich our world with their own unique perspectives and experiences.


School of Business and Economics

The School of Business and Economics (SBE) provides high-quality education and excellent research in business administration and economics with a focus on contributing to the social, economic and ecological challenges of our time. Whether it is the use of robots in society or big data, labour market participation or flexibility in the labour market, traffic jams or the housing market, flash crashes in the stock market or choice behaviour in gambling, leadership or change management: we believe in goal-oriented scientific research and understand that progress in academics, the business community and society is achieved through cooperation, openness and social responsibility.


At SBE, all of our highly-motivated colleagues work together closely in a stimulating, dynamic and international environment to achieve our collective goal of encouraging society to make informed choices. Approximately 4,200 Bachelor’s and Master’s students and 1,700 executive students are enrolled at the School, and employs roughly 500 people.


About the Marketing Department

We are a research oriented group that offers a stimulating environment and a dynamic international culture. Our faculty is a highly collaborative group and open, and publishes in the major marketing journals, as well as several other (top level) outlets in economics, psychology, decision making, and interdisciplinary journals. We have also organized a number of high quality conferences and symposia, including a JAMS Thought Leadership conference (2017), the inaugural IMRC conference (2018, in collaboration with Journal of Interactive Marketing), and our VU consumer research symposium (2016, 2018, 2021).


The department offers courses at all levels and participates in the school’s PhD program. Our MSc in Marketing (in English, 150-200 students) was rated best master in The Netherlands in the 2018 annual Master survey. In addition, we offer a part-time MSc in Marketing for executives, and teach courses in the various (Research) Master and BSc programs in the fields of business, economics and data science. Teaching is mostly in English, but also some Dutch courses. A list of marketing faculty is given here:

https://sbe.vu.nl/en/departments-and-institutes/marketing/staff/index.aspx

Who are we?

Travix is part of Trip.com Group Limited (Nasdaq: TCOM), besides Trip.com, Ctrip, Skyscanner, and Qunar. The group is a leading one-stop travel service provider and one of the largest travel companies in the world.

Travix is one of the leading global online travel agencies with the brands CheapTickets, Vliegwinkel, BudgetAir, Flugladen and Vayama. Our mission is ‘the next journey at your fingertips’, which goes for both customers and employees. We provide extensive search and book capabilities for flights, hotels, rental cars and products such as insurances and parking. With 5 brands in over 40 countries and with over 55 different nationalities employed, a global mindset comes natural to us. Are you ready for a new journey at Travix?

Get a lot of responsibility and opportunities to own ideas
Support the Marketing team in various tasks across other marketing channels

You have a creative mindset exploding with ideas and a great willingness to meticulously learn the art of Content Marketing
You love writing and have excellent storytelling skills as well as a good eye for winning images and creatives
You love travelling and want to inspire others to travel too!
You are organized, self-disciplined, able to manage multiple competing priorities and deliver results under tight deadlines
You are eager to learn, hands-on and not afraid to try something new.

What you can expect:

A laptop to use during your internship
You will be thrown into the deep end and will get real responsibilities from day one!
A mentor who will guide you through your internship
Boost your Content Marketing knowledge through the roof; you will be able to tell your teachers at Uni how SEO strategies and content marketing work in practice
You will learn the tricks and traits of the flight industry from all the different angles, one of the most dynamic markets out there
We love to hear your ideas so there is a good deal of room to be creative and to build your legacy
Become part of a multinational team of specialists to inspire and support you!
Fun (online) team events
Internship allowance of €750 (gross) plus full travel costs between home and office covered

Aan de slag als Digital Assistent Floormanager in Amstelveen?
Bent u multi-inzetbaar, zorgvuldig en digitaal vaardig? Bij 65plus In het Onderwijs zijn wij op zoek naar AOW-gerechtigde kandidaten die willen werken als Assistent Floormanager bij een middelbare school, MBO, HBO of universiteit. Bekijk de volledige vacature en solliciteer.

Wat gaat u doen?
De Assistent Floormanager Digitaal Toetsen heeft een essentiële rol en vormt de spil tussen faculteiten, ondersteunende diensten en externe partijen tijdens de afname van digitale toetsen. Hierbij werkt u nauw samen met docenten, ICT-ondersteuners en surveillanten en heeft u een coördinerende rol tijdens het afnemen van een examen. Samen met de faculteiten en de Floormanager waarborgt u de kwaliteit en betrouwbaarheid van het proces rondom de afname van de toetsen. U ziet toe op het naleven van de geldende regels, afspraken en procedures.

Wat verwachten wij van u als Assistent Floormanager?
Als Assistent Floormanager kunt u via ons worden ingezet bij het voortgezet onderwijs, mbo, hbo en/of universiteit. Het is een pre als u ervaring heeft in het hoger onderwijs met relevante kennis en ervaring met de inzet en werking van digitale toetsapplicaties en classroom management software.
Verder heeft u ervaring met het gebruik van ICT-middelen in brede zin en goede kennis van de MS-Office software in het bijzonder. De werktijden variëren van 08:00 tot 22:00 en vereisen een flexibele inzet voornamelijk tijdens de piekweken.
U bent communicatief sterkUitleg geven aan grote groepen is voor u geen probleemU heeft een sterk verantwoordelijkheidsgevoelU bent in staat om prioriteiten te stellen door hoofd- en bijzaken te onderscheidenU beschikt over aantoonbare computervaardighedenU beschikt over een sterk ontwikkeld gevoel voor dienstverleningU werkt uitstekend in teamverbandU beschikt over uitstekende communicatieve vaardigheden in het Nederlands en Engels en kan dit toepassen via de mail, telefoon en helpdesk software.

Over 65plus In het Onderwijs
Maak kennis met 65plus In het Onderwijs, dé arbeidsbemiddelaar in de onderwijssector. Al sinds 1975 plaatsen wij onderwijsmedewerkers bij uiteenlopende onderwijsinstellingen in Nederland, zoals basisscholen, middelbare scholen en het beroepsonderwijs. Ook plaatsen wij onderwijsmedewerkers in het volwassenenonderwijs en het speciaal onderwijs (remedial teachers). In ons bestand hebben wij examinatoren, surveillanten, beoordelaars, docenten, huiswerkbegeleiders, conciërges, receptionisten, klusjesmannen en schoonmakers. Afhankelijk van de functie beschikken de medewerkers over lesbevoegdheden.

Solliciteer nú
Voldoet u aan het functieprofiel en wilt u graag aan de slag als assistent floormanager? Solliciteer direct via de ‘solliciteer button’ of door contact op te nemen met ons regiokantoor Noord-Holland in Zaandam. Bel naar 020 610 56 02 of stuur een e-mail naar planningamsterdam@65plus.nl. Geef bij uw sollicitatie duidelijk aan in welk vakgebied u ervaring heeft, welke werkzaamheden u eerder heeft uitgevoerd en wat uw beschikbaarheid is.

Wilt u graag aan de slag, maar zoekt u net een andere functie? Wij hebben diverse (soortgelijke) vacatures! Bekijk de vacatures van onze specialisaties In het Onderwijs, Op de Weg en In Goede Handen of schrijf u vrijblijvend in.

Aan de slag als surveillant in Amstelveen?
Bent u multi-inzetbaar, zorgvuldig én deskundig? Bij 65plus In het Onderwijs zijn wij geregeld op zoek naar AOW-medewerkers die willen werken als surveillant bij een middelbare school, mbo, hbo of universiteit. Zo zoeken wij momenteel voor een opdrachtgever in de omgeving Amstelveen een ervaren en gemotiveerde surveillant. Naast het uitdelen en innemen van de toets papieren horen taken als identiteitscontrole, controle op hulpmiddelen, toezicht houden en begeleiden van studenten tot uw takenpakket. U realiseert zich dat de student een groot belang heeft bij het halen van een goed cijfer en ervan uit gaat dat de toets in alle rust en conform de juiste protocollen verloopt. U draagt er zorg voor dat deze situatie wordt gewaarborgd en bent rustig en respectvol in uw communicatie. Enthousiast? Bekijk de volledige vacature en solliciteer.
Wat gaat u doen?
Ter ondersteuning van de surveillantenpool is onze opdrachtgever in Amsterdam op zoek naar een ervaren en deskundige man of vrouw die als surveillant wil werken. In deze functie zal u de volgende werkzaamheden uitvoeren:
Ontvangen van studenten en begeleiden naar toets ruimte.
Identiteitsbewijs controleren.
Tentamens uitdelen en innemen.
Alert zijn op spieken en andere fraude mogelijkheden.
Administratieve afwikkeling en inleveren van de tentamens.
Wat verwachten wij van u als surveillant?
Als surveillant kunt u via ons worden ingezet bij het voortgezet onderwijs, mbo, hbo en/of universiteit. Wij werken met roosters waarbij u gedurende een studiejaar gemiddeld elke 6 weken ingezet kunt worden op diensten. Uiteraard krijgt u van ons de juiste instructies om uw werk te kunnen uitvoeren. Heeft u nog geen ervaring met surveilleren dan wordt u ook ingewerkt door een ervaren surveillant. U bent medeverantwoordelijk voor een goed en eerlijk verloop van het tentamen, examen of ander toets moment. Wij verwachten van u dat in de tentamenperioden meerdere dagen beschikbaar bent en dat u zich flexibel opstelt tijdens de uitvoering van uw werkzaamheden. U dient er rekening mee te houden dat het surveilleren bij elke onderwijsvorm of opleiding anders kan zijn georganiseerd.
Wie zoekt 65plus In het Onderwijs?
Als surveillant kunt u aan de slag gaan bij een middelbare school, mbo, hbo of universiteit. U bent medeverantwoordelijk voor een goed en eerlijk verloop van het tentamen, examen of ander toetsingsmoment. U bent hierbij breed inzetbaar, want uw werkzaamheden bestaan onder andere uit het uitdelen en innemen van examen- of tentamenpapieren en het doen van identiteitscontroles en controles van hulpmiddelen. Naast multi-inzetbaar bent u ook zorgvuldig en deskundig; u zorgt voor een betrouwbare, valide én transparante toetsing en handhaaft hierbij de criteria van de examencommissie.
U bent woonachtig in de omgeving van Amsterdam.
U bent digitaal vaardig.
U bent flexibel inzetbaar in werktijden en op locaties.
U heeft een goede lichamelijke fitheid, zoals vier uur kunnen staan/lopen.
U heeft een verzorgde en representatieve uitstraling.
U bent collegiaal en kunt tevens zelfstandig werken.
U heeft gevoel en begrip voor hiërarchische verhoudingen tijdens het werk.
U beschikt over inlevings- en aanpassingsvermogen.
U kunt volgens wisselende instructies op een respectvolle manier orde en regels handhaven.
U bent minimaal 3 dagen per week beschikbaar (1-3 diensten per dag) in de vaste tentamenperioden.

Solliciteer direct
Voldoet u aan het functieprofiel en wilt u graag aan de slag als surveillant? Aarzel niet en solliciteer vandaag nog via de ‘solliciteer button’ en volg de verdere instructies. Wanneer uw profiel en arbeidswensen aansluiten op de vacature en eisen van onze opdrachtgever, nemen wij telefonisch of per e-mail contact met u op. Heeft u nog vragen over werken via 65plus? Bekijk dan zeker onze veelgestelde vragen (FAQ).

Job Title: Mandarin / Chinese teacher & optional Chinese cooking teacher
Job Description: We are looking for a Chinese teacher to teach Chinese to our company director Jeroen. He already passed HSK 1, 2, 3 and 4. But he needs to refresh it and then his goal is to eventually obtain HSK 5. Writing with a pen is not important, but to learn to select the right characters via pinyin is relevant. Of course his vocal skills and listening ability are top priority. Jeroen wants to improve his Chinese, so he can better talk directly with Chinese factory bosses while visiting China. This will help him more easily build a meaningful partnership with them to improve mutual understanding and eventually to help grow his business.In order to cultivate a Chinese learning environment the more Chinese talk the better. So from this perspective Jeroen is also interested in getting Chinese cooking classes in Chinese.You don't need to have a teaching or cooking education for this job. But you need to be fluent in Chinese and to be good at cooking is of course a plus. The job might be perfect for a student. Job Title: Hoofd basisjaar voor 16 uur per week (0,4 fte)

Job Description:
Who we are:
Jamf, the standard for Apple in the enterprise, extends the legendary Apple experience people love to businesses, schools, and government organizations by simplifying Mac, iPad, iPhone and Apple TV deployment, management and security — anytime, anywhere.
We are a group of curious, self-starters with a passion for helping people make sense of technology – freeing nurses to care, teachers to teach and businesses to thrive. We take pride in making meaningful impact for tens of thousands of customers around the globe, all the while getting to work with the best Apple infrastructure and security platform in the world. We have over 1,300 employees worldwide with offices in the U.S., Europe, Japan, and Australia. To learn more visit: https://www.jamf.com/careers.
What you’ll do at Jamf:
At Jamf, we empower people to be their best selves and do their best work. The Jamf Systems Engineer (also known as a Sales Engineer or pre-Sales) primary role is to partner with other members of the Sales Team to achieve sales goals. This position will evaluate technical requirements of new sales opportunities and present technical solutions to meet the needs of prospective, existing customers and partners.

Responsibilities
Be the technical point of contact for prospective and existing customers throughout the sales process.
Work jointly with the sales team on strategy & discovery sessions, in order to understand customer requirements, and develop targeted technical solutions with unique business value.
Demonstrate Jamf products to prospective customers, either remotely or directly on site.
Support product evaluations, proof of concept, and pilot implementations of Jamf solutions to timely success.
Identify the ongoing service needs of customers and recommend support and service engagements in order to ensure customer success.
Support the sales team in achieving revenue and billings goals while maintaining a high level of customer satisfaction.
Represent Jamf by presenting at conferences, events, community groups and roadshows.
Assist the global SE team via product testing and knowledge sharing
Special projects as assigned
4-year / Bachelor’s Degree (Preferred)
A combination of relevant experience and education may be considered
Native or extremely fluent level of business English (Required)
5 years+ in technical sales, support or services experiences (Required)
Experience with presenting/speaking to an audience on technical topics
At least one of the following is required:
Proficient with Apple technology within a business or education environment.
MDM, EMM industry or relevant experience with software vendor.


How we help you reach your best potential:

We are progressive, but laid back. You are free to be you and work how you work best. Here, you manage your own day and your own work style.
Our people are what make us great, and we protect our people. Jamfs across the globe receive a superior compensation and benefits package.
Everyone has a voice and everyone can make a difference, our more than 90% employee retention rate agrees!
Opportunity to make a real and meaningful impact for more than 38,000 global customers with the best Apple device management solution in the world.
We put people over profits – which is why our customers keep coming back to us.
Ability to support and give back to your community through volunteer paid time off.
We embrace all perspectives. Our employee led I&D groups encourage employees to make real, actionable differences here at Jamf.
24 of 25 world’s most valuable brands rely on Jamf to do their best work (as ranked by Forbes).
Over 100,000 Jamf Nation users, the largest online IT community in the world.


You are the right kind of Jamf if:
You go above and beyond for others, genuine and willing to help, always. You support the team around you, you don’t point fingers or pass blame. You take responsibility for your actions, are open, and respect others. You value different perspectives, in how you work and how you learn. You are naturally inquisitive, like to create and be creative. You are a problem solver, curious and resourceful, self-driven and constantly improving. You roll up your sleeves and dig in. You are excited by not knowing what may lie ahead. You are willing to take risks, try new things, even fail just to do it better next time. You’re not a jerk. You put people first. You are a good person, someone who just wants to do the right thing.


Why Jamf?
Our mission is simple; we help organizations succeed with Apple. At Jamf, we put people first. We focus on the human before we focus on the technology. We are just good people that have it at their core to do what’s right – for our customers, our employees and our communities.


Get social with us: Instagram, LinkedIn, & Facebook
